Source: The Game Website.

185681.name: Shonen Idle
185681.description:
The KuroWashi army and fearsome monsters have taken control of the world and are opressing your people. Train and master your skills to be strongest fighter ever and finish their evil deeds. Will you deserve to be considered the greatest hero of them all?

Source: The Game Website.

185682.name: Awesome Seaquest
185682.description:
Take on the red army in this sea based follow up to Awesome Conquest! Incrementally build your navy, research special weapons and take back your territory.

Source: The Game Website.

185683.name: Sugar, sugar 3
185683.description:
I made a new episode of that sugary and chill puzzle game, it’s sugar, sugar 3 time! You know the deal: draw and get enough sugar in the cups in 30 sweet levels.

Source: The Game Website.

185684.name: Heroes Empire: TCG
185684.description:
Forge your own empire with the help of the greatest historical and mythological heroes!

- RECRUIT Mythological & Historical Heroes to lead your army: King Arthur, Alexander the Great, Spartacus, Leonidas, Hercules, Achilles and many more!

- CLAIM your own Castle, gather resources and unlock unique rewards!

- BUILD your army with famous historical units from multiple civilizations: Greek, Romans, Aztecs, Vikings, Ancient Japan & China and more!

- JOIN other players in powerful Alliances and battle each other to claim the top of the ranks!

- FIGHT through a never ending campaign, constantly updated and with awesome rewards!

- TAKE PART in famous themed Adventures, battle in the glorious Roman Colosseum or visit the mysterious island of Avalon.

Source: The Game Website.

185685.name: Castle Kaboom
185685.description:
Making castles go kablooey isn’t easy but somebody’s gotta do it, right?

Source: The Game Website.

185686.name: ARMY FORCE ONLINE - Multiplayer FPS
185686.description:
Dive deep into this awesome 3D multiplayer first person shooting game! Your mission is to shoot daunting opposing soldiers. No matter what game mode you choose you can use a wide variety of lethal weapons to defeat your enemy forces online.

Source: The Game Website.

185687.name: Brazen Clicker
185687.description:
Click your way through a horde of monsters, recruit heroes, build a party, collect loot, then lay waste to the endless waves of monsters!

Source: The Game Website.

185688.name: Business
185688.description:
Hey, it is my third game. I am 15 years old and live in Moscow/Russia. Ok, now about game. In this game you can control 25! types of business. Each business gives you income. When you start business, income increases and you receive more money per second. Also you can buy upgrades. When you will have enough money, you can hire managers, who will run your businesses automatically. Each type of business has it’s own business run time. When you will have a lot of money, you can reset the game and buy some bonuses on credits. Also you can level up in this game. This game also has other features. I think that is all. And sorry 4 my bad English.

Source: The Game Website.

185689.name: Drop Wizard
185689.description:
It’s magic versus bunnies in this enchanted world. Which side will come out on top?

Source: The Game Website.

185690.name: Tim_
185690.description:
Tim_ is a short puzzle/plataform game, about time and decisions. #2 on the GBJAM 2014

Source: The Game Website.

185691.name: Sherlock Holmes 2
185691.description:
The police is convinced Charles Williams has murdered Jimmy Johnston, but Holmes thinks otherwise. Can you help him prove Charles’ innocence?

Source: The Game Website.

185692.name: Transport Defender
185692.description:
Patrol operation failed. Now we need to retreat.
Destroy all enemies chasing us and reach the base.
Buy new weapons, upgrade them and shoot!

WEBGL + Chrome version needs some time to load first time, following runs must be faster.
I suggest playing WebPlayer version in Firefox for better performance and faster load times.

Also in chrome Unity Web Player support can be re-enabled by pasting this into your chrome address bar:

Source: The Game Website.

185693.name: Drink Beer, Neglect Family
185693.description:
You are a disillusioned father. Drink as much beer as you can while avoiding pictures of your family. Every beer you drink applies a different negative effect: some make you throw up every few seconds, others limit your movement in some way, and so forth.

Source: The Game Website.

185694.name: Level Editor 4
185694.description:
The new “Level Editor” is here!

This little stickman punches in above his wimpy weight.

Place blocks to overcome obstacles and get this little stickman to each level’s door. Collect coins along the way to boost your time.

Source: The Game Website.

185695.name: Puzzle Tower
185695.description:
Help your hero to escape from the tower

Source: The Game Website.

185696.name: The Green Kingdom
185696.description:
King of The Green Kingdom love peace.
He always was against the war.
He loves his friends – The King of Gray Kingdom, The King of Yellow Kingdom and The King of Blue Kingdom.
But once everything went wrong…
And everyone he love turns to him with swords and blood…

Source: The Game Website.

185697.name: A Matter of Caos: Episode 4
185697.description:
he last chapter begins!

Mr. Gilbert seems to be at the end of his investigations; will he get to save Daphne? Is she still alive?

Who wanted the Caos Heart, and why? What is Lee’s plan? What’s the truth behind Lora Malaguard?
All will be revealed in this Gran Finale!

Source: The Game Website.

185698.name: WW2-4U
185698.description:
A Multiplayer WW2-Shooter with a lovely simple graphic-style. Choose your side and capture strategic points for your country.

It is my first public game ever and it still has a lot of bugs, but I think it’s already fun, so I want to know what you think about it.
I will ship some Updates soon.

Source: The Game Website.

185699.name: Deepest Dungeon
185699.description:
CURRENTLY IN ALPHA!

Dare you dive into the world’s first Dungeon Crawlevator?

Load your party up into Deepest Dungeon’s elevator and start fighting your way down through the floors. Level up your characters, find new members for your party, buy powerful new weapons, and try not to hum with the elevator muzak between floors.

Source: The Game Website.

185700.name: Egg Knight
185700.description:
Eggcellent!
Save the Egg Knight world by defeating the Dark Army!
Assemble your troops by collecting Knights that hatch from eggs!
Go collect all the Egg Knights!

Fight the Dark Army in a wild meadow, forgotten forest, or on the beach.
Aid your Egg Knight in battle with the Arcana skill or eggxperimenting with the Egg Knight strategy to strengthen your troops even more!

Discover the eggciting fantasy world of Egg Knight by Goody Gameworks.

TIPS:
-———————
Don’t quit the game while in cut-scene or hatching menu, there’s report for this causing save game to corrupt.
-———————

Source: The Game Website.

185701.name: Realm Grinder
185701.description:
Fancy being a benevolent king or a cruel tyrant? Choose an alignment between Good and Evil and form alliances with multiple races such as fairies, elves, angels, goblins, undead and demons in order to improve your coin output. Click to harvest your treasure, build your almighty empire, unleash your magic upon the land and be the richest ruler of the realm!

You will unlock new upgrades and spells by achieving certain goals such as as building a certain amount of structures, clicking treasure enough times, casting spells or grinding hours of gameplay. Some requirements will remain unlocked through sessions, but most will not.

Each faction gets access to unique spells, perks and upgrades which will shape your gameplay in different ways, from very active to almost completely idle based. You may ally with a single faction during each game session: faction alliances will be reset when you soft reset, allowing you to switch alignments and affiliations.

When you are satisfied with your rulership and wish to restart your adventure, press the Soft Reset button in the Options tab. Doing so will convert all your coins, buildings and upgrades into Gems, which will boost your next session’s overall production. All trophies along with some stats will be saved and recorded throughout sessions, resulting in better bonuses.

Collect trophies to improve the output of your Halls of Legends, the most expensive – but potentially the most efficient! – building available in the game.

Source: The Game Website.

185702.name: Void Vikings
185702.description:
Void Vikings is an action packed 2.5D top down space shooter. Pilot three different ships with special maneuvers and each with their own fantastic abilities to destroy your enemies. Pillage loot they leave behind to outfit your ship becoming even more powerful. Warp from system to system to take on larger and stronger waves of enemies. Death is the end but the glory from your battle will carry on.

Source: The Game Website.

185703.name: Astrobots
185703.description:
The space marine should find his friends in the deep of a dangerous asteroid.

Source: The Game Website.

185704.name: Give Up 2
185704.description:
You’re back, trapped for Tasselfoot’s amusement once again. Will you survive this time or will you GIVE UP?

Fair warning: GIVE UP 2 is face-meltingly difficult. You will give up. -Tass

Source: The Game Website.

185705.name: That Red Button
185705.description:
That red button, is a puzzle platformer game about: copying things, a mom bot, a little robot and a mysterious mission.

Enjoy it, its free!

Source: The Game Website.

185706.name: Balloon Hero
185706.description:
The heroes are out and all we have now is Balloon Hero. Help him evade all the obstacles and escape the tower! Keep away from spikes, flames and those spiky creatures that might pop the balloons!

Source: The Game Website.

185707.name: The Last Samurai
185707.description:
Dynamic platformer game with fully destructible world. Play as a samurai, use your shurikens and powder bombs to destroy everything around you, defend yourself from angry red ninjas, and find all secret scrolls on each level.

Source: The Game Website.

185708.name: G-Switch 2
185708.description:
Run and flip gravity in all directions and discover the truth about your existence.

Find the 7 secret orbs and unlock new characters.

Local multiplayer mode with up to EIGHT players on one keyboard!

Source: The Game Website.

185709.description:
Beasts of Balance is a game of strategy and balance in which you build a tower of animals on your tabletop, then help them evolve in a connected digital world.

A cooperative game for one to five players, the aim is to make the most fabulous world you can by strategically nurturing and evolving your creatures and casting skill-based miracles - before your tower collapses.

Players take turns to stack a set of beautifully made artifacts into a tower. As they're placed they pop onto the connected device's screen, where they'll be seen to evolve and grow as players continue to make tactical choices over how they build.

Our in-house designed technology uses a unique combination of sensors to recognize the pieces in play, connecting to the device over Bluetooth to tablets and smartphones running iOS or Android.
185709.name: Beasts of Balance
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 096 - Agricola ACBS and Cthulhu ADBG
5. Devon Dice Podcast chat show

185710.name: Time To Type
185710.description:
Nice and simple – type fast and avoid mistakes.

Source: The Game Website.

185711.name: Blang
185711.description:
Out of the job and to run your own business in this brand new puzzler, make chains of gems for art and profit. (beta)

Source: The Game Website.

185712.name: The only game better than Fancy Pants
185712.description:
Inspired by james_kholamian. Seriously, blame him.

Source: The Game Website.

185713.name: Piplet Extreme
185713.description:
Fusionary’s take on a classic puzzle game.

Source: The Game Website.

185714.name: Foley's Follies
185714.description:
I have the wrong title for the game. It’s only supposed to be FlipGSN, where you mouse over the squares and try to make all the squares in the game the same color

Source: The Game Website.

185715.name: The Classroom 3
185715.description:
Prequel to The Classroom series.

Source: The Game Website.

185716.name: Fungus
185716.description:
Grow as big and many fungi as you can in two minutes.
Also, this game was conceived, designed and made in three days as a part of my prototyprally.

Source: The Game Website.

185717.name: Orbox B
185717.description:
Outstanding puzzle! Slide box from block to block to solve level. Different missions to complete. 30 levels. Special features – bombs, teleports, sensors, reflectors.

Source: The Game Website.

185718.name: Battle Pirates (2006)
185718.description:
Art by Ollie the magic hobo
Actionscripting by Corkysurprise
Works best in Flash Player 7 and above.

With your arsenal of pirate weapons and a head full of strategy, blast away those enemy pirates and purge the seven seas!

Create your own team and pit it against the CPU, or someone you just dont like. This is the result of 4 months of work, we hope you enjoy.

Source: The Game Website.

185719.name: The Game of Disorientation
185719.description:
Going left has never been so hard.

Source: The Game Website.

185720.name: Magnetism
185720.description:
Maneuver a metallic ball through a series of magnet-filled levels.

Source: The Game Website.

185721.name: Warp Forest
185721.description:
Driving, shooting and puzzle-solving all in one.

Source: The Game Website.

185722.name: Paths
185722.description:
Challenging next-gen mouse game!

Source: The Game Website.

185723.name: Orbox
185723.description:
Take a seat and focus your mind for 30 levels of puzzle greatness.

Source: The Game Website.

185724.name: Paths 2
185724.description:
The sequel to Paths! Tons of challenging levels.

Source: The Game Website.

185725.name: Tetris Holdem
185725.description:
A mixture of two of the greatest games in the world – Tetris and Texas Holdem Poker!

Source: The Game Website.

185726.name: President or Playmate
185726.description:
Are you capable of differngtiating the speech patters of our 43rd President from 1993’s Playmate of the Year?

In this game you will be presented with different quotes – your job is to figure out which of these prominent public figures the quote is credited to.

Be careful, it’s harder than it looks!

Source: The Game Website.

185727.description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, except the special express route.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
185727.name: Wales (fan expansion to Ticket to Ride)

185728.name: Midnight Wolf
185728.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Monster-Hunting Monster

Determined to remove his curse, Adam Gregory seeks the origin of lycanthropy, but during his travels, he encounters other supernatural creatures who wish to do harm to the humans they live among. As Midnight Wolf (PL 10), Adam, uses his powers to protect those same humans from evil agents of the occult.

185729.name: The Sentinels
185729.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Sentinels!

The Sentinels Agenda is a program overseen by CASTLE (the "Committee of Advanced Strategy, Technology, and Law Enforcement") to bring together extraordinary individuals to deal with impossible problems. It's had a revolving membership over the years, but began with a core of two CASTLE agents, Knight Ranger (expert archer), and Red Widow (covert agent). Iconic Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

185730.name: Zombies
185730.description:
From publisher blurb:

When you think of a zombie, most have a pretty clear idea of what they look like. But what IS that mental image? Are all zombies the same?

After all, they were once people when they was alive and people come in various shapes and species so why not the zombie as well?

The CDG range is designed with a fantasy setting in mind, but can easily be used for sci-fi or modern/horror settings.

This CDG gives you ideas for

Apparent Previous Life
Clothing
Disfigurements & Wounds
Head
Limbs
Movement
Size & Weight
Skin condition
Sounds & Smell
Quirks & Features

185731.name: Dr. Wachsfigur
185731.description:
From publisher blurb:

Behold the magical creations of... Dr. Wachsfigur!

A Power Level 10 Rogue, Dr. Wachsfigur has spent centuries perfecting her art. A sociopath with centuries of practice, she is obsessed with creating things of beauty from wax, and bringing them to life! Wachsfigur is a classic villain archetype in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

Wachsfigur is designated "Violet" for her magical origins. Ghoulishly inspired by classic Hammer horror films, she makes for a fun Halloween-themed mastermind villain. Her morbid machinations would certainly draw the attention of detective-themed heroes, while her mindless minions might make her a fearsome foe for psychic-powered heroes.

185732.name: Core Prestige Classes (Barbarian, Bard, and Cleric)
185732.description:
From publisher blurb:

Prestige classes have taken a back seat to archetypes and hybrid classes of late. Presented are three new prestige classes built upon the core classes they represent. These prestige classes offering an accelerated method of gaining a secondary core class without the need to multi-class for several levels to gain the same functionality. The compromise is that each prestige class focuses on a particular class ability or two rather than granting all of the class features normally associated with the class in question. So if you want a sorcerer that can rage or a fighter that likes to pick up the lute to inspire his friends on occasion, check out these new prestige classes.

185733.name: Midmoon: The City of Guilds
185733.description:
Midmoon: The City of Guilds is an economic strategy game with the elements of RPG. The action takes place in Midmoon, city of the Dreamscape carnival universe. Players take part in settlement development that gradually evolves from small town to a big megapolis. Players take roles of businessmen planning to capture the authority in future city.

It's possible to play in a legal way by building a trade empire that leans on the powerful guards or to rule from the shadows by hiring thieves and killers. A skillful player can combine both ways.

185734.name: Postcards
185734.description:
From the Introduction:

As players you will take turns to imagine a postcard sent from a travelling teddy home to its owner. You will have a theme or idea to include, and a backpack to add a souvenir to and full of things to help you.

185735.name: Mutt Movers
185735.description:
From the Introduction:

Mutt Movers is the role-playing game of moving mutts across the country from high kill shelters to rescue groups in areas where the dogs are in greater demand and likely to be adopted by families. The moves are coordinated by a monitor who typically supervises a number of drivers transporting mutts along a fixed route. Most of these start early in the day and rely on drivers who typically drive about one hour, then meet the next driver. They let the dogs take a water and potty break, then load them up in the next car headed for the rescue.

In this game, players can take on the role of mutts (all dogs on a move are called mutts regardless of their breed) or movers (the drivers who are helping to take dogs to a forever home). The game can be played with or without a Control. While the normal role of the Control on a mutt move is to keep drivers informed of the schedule, in the game Control is the person who generates the non-player participants in the move, both mutts and movers, and breathes life into them.

The object of the game is to achieve your character goal, which for most players will be to arrive at the destination rescue with all the mutts still in good health. This is how it nearly always goes in real-life, but of course there has to be more drama in the game or it will lose a lot of tension and probably fun.

185736.name: Lucky Cake
185736.description: Lucky Cake is a children's game that features a cake.

185737.name: Serves You Right
185737.description:
The murder doesn't matter - the blackmail does.

From the Introduction:

The Blackmoor-Winters family has been murdered! However, they had it coming to them. What is more troublesome is that some member of the household has decided to call the constables. Which means you have precisely one hour to blackmail all the servants into telling the "truth" about what happened - a truth which just so happens to paint you as completely innocent.

185738.name: Visou
185738.description:
You have a good eye? Learn to recognize the places, monuments, characters, landscapes, buildings and the most famous works of art.

Roll the color dice for the categorie of the card, take a card, look at the pictures, identify the named one and earn that card.

The first player to win three cards in three different categories or six cards of the same categorie wins.

185739.name: Puki Duki
185739.description: Puki Duki is a children's game with animals. That is all.

185740.name: Tome of Beasts
185740.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Horde of New 5th Edition Monsters!

DM: “A collection of hundreds of eyes floats down the corridor toward you, trailing ganglia and dripping caustic fluid that sizzles when it hits the ground. What do you do?”
PLAYER: “I retire, and become a farmer.”

Whether you need dungeon vermin or a world-shaking personification of evil, the Tome of Beasts has it. Here are more than 400 new foes for your 5th Edition game-everything from tiny drakes and peculiar spiders, to demon lords and ancient dragons.

Tome of Beasts includes monsters from the entire history of Kobold Press, with longtime favorites such as:

Clockwork creatures
Drakes and dragons
Devils and arch-devils
Dangerous flavors of the fey
Undead-and much more!




Use them in your favorite published setting, or populate the dungeons in a world of your own creation. Pick up Tome of Beasts and give your players an encounter they won’t soon forget!

185741.name: Book of Lairs
185741.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fight the Monster in its Den … If You Dare!

Book of Lairs brings you 24 great one-shot, monster lairs for 5th edition! Each of these exciting and unusual battlegrounds comes with a complete short adventure, including a hook, area hazards, tactics, and treasures, and many use monsters from the Tome of Beasts. Stage your 5th Edition fights in unforgettable locations like:

Alchemist’s Guildhall
Necromancer’s Cistern
Clockwork Tower
Den of the Rotten Kings
Lost Halls of Everforge
A Pirate Cove
Crypt of the Warlock
Citadel of the Void Dragon
A Dark Grove
Lost Fane of the Serpents
Branches of Yggdrasil
Tomb of the Scorpion Prince
Sky Stairs of Beldestan
Imperial Ghoul Outpost
Umbral Vampire Lair
And 10 more!

185742.name: Xerospace
185742.description:
User summary:

Characters in Xerospace have six Traits (Attributes), namely: Dexterity, Movement, Size, Perception, Tech, and Psionic. Characters select two traits in which they are "better than most" and two traits in which they are "not as good as most". Traits are then assigned values of 5, 6, or 7, depending on their categorization. Each trait in turn yields up to three starting Skills and each character may select a total of five starting Skills. Characters will start with Skill Values of 5-10. Characters also have a variety of other traits including Mutations, Life and Energy. Mutations are special abilities (beneficial) and work much like bonus Skills.

Skill resolution is performed by 2d6 plus related Skill Value plus related Trait Value, producing a number from 1-21. Various types of success (or failure) are supported based on the results--each Skill uses a unique chart of results. Whenever a character rolls "Doubles" on a Skill check this is noted and eventually leads to a Skill Value increase.

Combat is atypical inasmuch as each "turn" is divided into three "rounds" which are, in order, Preparation Round, Maneuver Round, and Resolution Round. Combat otherwise resolves much like a Skill resolution. Note that "Combat between spacecraft should be run just like combat between individuals".

185743.description: The Path of Repentance is the first add on pack for the 7th Continent and will contain 30 or so cards that will allow you to manage an adversary that not even the most proficient adventurer can escape: Time itself.
185743.name: The 7th Continent: Path of Repentance

185744.name: Ti-Joe Connaissant
185744.description:
Ti-Joe Connaissant is a quiz game inspired directly by "Joe connaissant". Designed for children aged 7 years and older, it offers to young smart two ways to play. The reversible game board shows a cooperative version and a competitive version of the game. The puzzles cover a range of topics tailored to the interests and level of knowledge of the youngest.

Version Cooperative
Players must solve all puzzles in order to accumulate 20 points. To encourage the players have six supporters that should not be disappointed by wrong answers.

Competitive Version
Three supporters of two teams clash. The team that will solve most puzzles with the least indices and has the fewest disappointed supporters will win the game.

185745.name: Tainted Olive - Chapter 1
185745.description:
What to expect?

- a deep, relatively dark story
- LOTS of text and dialogue!
- interesting characters and world
- good puzzles
- hand-drawn graphics
- 20 – 30 minutes of gameplay

You are Silvian, an adventurer down on his luck. The curtain unfolds, and we find you in an inn filled with scum and gamblers – a place where people go only when they need to forget, or be forgotten. Dark thoughts haunt your mind while you drown yourself in wine, searching for answers that don’t exist.

Source: The Game Website.

185746.name: Slaver Port
185746.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 272nd of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features slave hunting ships being refit in a slaver port.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

185747.name: Sky Ace (24-Hour RPG Version)
185747.description:
User summary:

Sky Ace is a 24-hour RPG product from 2005. The game is played with a standard pack of playing cards driving all actions. The first part of the rules describes card handling and rules to drive miniatures tactical combat. The game can be used as a standalone tactical exercise. The second part of the rules describes the integration of the miniatures and card aspects of the game into an ongoing role-playing game experience with a process for character advancement.

However, by far the most interesting aspect of the game is the use of cards to drive combat, etc. The various role-playing elements are traditional and very light-weight.

185748.name: Hypercorps 2099: Primer
185748.description:
From publisher blurb:

This quick introduction to the Hyper Score system of Hypercorps 2099 is the means by which your fighter becomes a feared dark avenger, your mage becomes a supreme sorcerer, and your bard becomes a mega-rockstar!

In the 21 pages of this PDF you’ll find:

the Luck and Reputation attributes
Hyper Feats, hyper flaws, hyper routes, and hyper attributes
new skills like Athletics, Use Technology, and Vehicular Control
new firearms and other equipment (including the hoverboard!)
advanced craftsmanship for items of scientifically superior quality
the Hypercorps 2099 Pathfinder character sheet
everything you need to take your Pathfinder RPG game into a superheroic cyberpunk future

185749.name: Hypernet
185749.description:
From publisher blurb:

A world exists within the googols of electronic connections that encircle and suffuse Hypercorps 2099, a digital dimension that can be as a real as a bullet in the head—the Hypernet. Within the cybernetic landscape are trillions of users and countless servers, creating a frontier for adventure by the technologically adept or those powerful enough to traverse to other planes of existence.

The 12 pages within this PDF contain the core of the Hypernet:

the data spike trap
ghost assets haunt
Jarrikol global effect
overloaded bandwidth effect
server crash hazard
the robo-rex CM and unbound proxy CM
Darknet servers, the Datacorps, Thrillville, and Veranthea: Life & Death
everything you need to take any party on futuristic adventures in the digital frontier!

185750.name: Netjacker Base Class
185750.description:
From publisher blurb:

Netjackers are the elite hackers of Hypercorps 2099—adept at traversing the digital byways of the Hypernet, shredding air real time on a hoverboard, or taking on gigs against hypercorporations with nothing but their wits and a handful of drones!

In this 10 page PDF you’ll find the entirety of the netjacker base class, including:

several models of proxies and drones
hacking talents and advanced hacking talents
the Use Technology skill
everything you need to build your master of the digital world for a game in Hypercorps 2099!

185751.name: A R.I.P.E. Investment
185751.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder compatible adventure for 3-4 PCs of 3rd-4th level [hyper score 3].

Of all the hypercorporations in the world one of the most unique is R.I.P.E., an organic soap and perfume company. Unbeknownst to most these mages and priests use the business as a cover for acquiring rare and esoteric (but organic!) reagents for their spells without raising suspicion. One of their means to do so is by shipping across the Great Lakes and into the harbor of the wasteland that’s become of Cleveland. The operators are hired either to defend one of R.I.P.E.’s freight trucks and deliver it to a secure location, or take it for a shadowy organization with insidious intent (but much better pay).

Whichever they choose, it’s probably not good for Cleveland.

This exciting 17 page adventure module (which is also appropriate for PCs of 6th-7th level) contains:

2 scenarios for how to resolve the plot
an armored truck
Murderballaz gangers, Ki-Han Hyper Security Guards, and a total of 7 NPCs and creatures
4 different pre-generated PCs enhanced with the Hyper Score system
a city street map and warehouse map
everything you need to run this riveting adventure set in the wastelands of Cleveland in Hypercorps 2099!

rpgitemversion: PDF Version 0.8 (Advanced Rules with Sample Mission)
185752.name: Sky Ace (Advanced Version)
185752.description:
User summary:

Sky Ace (Advanced Version) is a re-worked and re-formatted version of the Sky Ace 24-Hour RPG. This edition is easier to follow than the first edition with clearer examples and improved flow. The card mechanics have been changed slightly but the game is essentially similar. The campaign version used for role-playing remains a secondary feature of the game where the primary focus is still tactical miniatures combat using cards as the driving factor.

The September 11, 2005 version of the rules includes a concise example mission.

185753.description:
Arnhem: Defient Stand and Oosterbeek Perimeter combined in one master set.The Battle of Arnhem in super detail, with a building by building map with big hexes (you can put a bunch of counters in each one).

10 mostly small scenarios
Two sheets of die cut counters with new art - big 3/4" AFV counters including lots of unusual German AFVs
Giant-hex two sheet map depicting downtown Arnhem in September 1944
Super-sized deluxe AFV cards for all AFV types
Sturdy box
Two ten-sided dice

Oosterbeek Perimeter is an stand-alone game that links with Arnhem: Defiant Stand that provides two additional maps and 16 more scenarios to expand your Battle of Arnhem action to include the entire British Airborne perimeter!

The new street-level maps at 50-yards scale provide the battlefield where King Tigers smashed toward the Hartenstein Hotel and numerous Victorica Crosses were won for bravery.

In keeping with the Advanced Tobruk approach you will receive a stack of small, fast-playing scenarios to get you on the maps right away, as well as monster-sized action across the entire map!

Features:
Two new historical game maps on heavyweight stock;
16 new Scenarios printed on separate heavyweight cards;
A snazzy ziploc bag to hold it all.
Both games in one package.
185753.name: Arnhem: Defiant Stand Master Set

185754.name: Hypercorps 2099: 5th Edition Playtest
185754.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the beginning of the Hyper Score system playtest for compatibility with the 5th Edition rules. Turn your fighter into a titan of strength, your rogue into a superbly stealthy dark avenger, your bard into a silver-tongued devil, or your mage into a grand wizard!

Within these 10 awesome pages you’ll find:

hero points for 5th Edition
the Luck and Reputation attributes
Hyper Feats, hyper flaws, hyper routes, and hyper ability traits
the Technology skill
new equipment
a peek into the setting of Hypercorps 2099
everything you need to take your 5th Edition game into the gritty future!

185755.name: Donutosaur
185755.description:
Help Donutosaur get his donut! Collect candies by changing the shape of Donutosaur and switching the direction of gravity. Donutosaur’s friends will be of great help – they can push, pull and destroy objects.

Source: The Game Website.

185756.name: Helixteus
185756.description:
Manage your home planet, build buildings and send spaceships to other planets to fight the enemies in order to conquer the planet in this infinite universe.

Source: The Game Website.

185757.name: Space Flash Arena
185757.description:
Space combat simulation in full 3D.

Fight with AI-driven enemies, collect guns and missiles, get medals for mastering each of 6 maps!

Source: The Game Website.

185758.name: The God Below
185758.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for novice characters

Strange gods aren’t unusual in the darkness cast by the shadow of the Demon Lord. New faiths appear regularly. Most fade away on their own, or, in the most repugnant cases, their adherents are hunted and murdered by the good folk they offended or endangered.

The God Below is an adventure for a group of novice characters. In it, the characters investigate the temple of a newly emerged religion to determine whether the god Duvia is a benevolent deity or a threat to safety and the existing order. The characters complete the adventure when they destroy the horror unearthed in the temple’s bowels.

185759.name: Okami (Browser)
185759.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Ōkami.




Run, jump, and collect coins.

Source: The Game Website.

185760.name: Ruinous Tales of Gothic Madness
185760.description:
From the Introduction:

Welcome to a nightmare world of overwrought gothic melodrama, where demented aristocrats indulge their horrific appetites, bandits lurk, supernatural beings creep about, guilt and shame are as dreaded as daggers, and when the story stalls, someone dies.

185761.name: Nightflies
185761.description:
Help the nightflies get to the lanterns.

Source: The Game Website.

185762.name: Give Up
185762.description:
Failure is inevitable, so why delay? Hit that Give Up button and be done with all this. No need to try to finish the game. I wouldn’t be impressed either way. But if you want to humor yourself you can at least try a few floors on for size.

Source: The Game Website.

185763.name: The Despair Wars
185763.description:
From the Introduction:

From the Thirteen Heavens of the Aztecs to the High Hall of Hel, the realms of the afterlife never want for tenants. Someone has to take departed souls to their final resting places and that someone is you. Your job has many names: psychopomp, guide, ferryman, ghost.

There are those who seek to take those souls for themselves and they grow bolder and more clever with each passing year. These Agents of Oblivion literally make the world a worse place. They deny the living their closure, they keep the dead from their rightful rewards or punishments, and they unbalance the metaphysical scales that keep the universe running.

185764.name: HEX: Health Endurance XP
185764.description:
User summary:

HEX - Health Endurance XP, is a solitaire one-page role-playing game. Characters start with three Attributes (Health, Endurance, and XP) with values of 6; and two Stats ([dungeon] Level and Keys) which start at 1 and 0, respectively. Characters proceed through a randomized dungeon which has nine named areas. The player makes simple choices at several points (generally, "Run Away" or "Fight" type actions). These actions result in preset adjustments to the three attributes. The player hopes gradually to accumulate three keys (from treasure rooms) which eventually will allow escape from the dungeon and "winning" the scenario.

185765.name: RPG: Rage Precognition Grace (24-Hour Version)
185765.description:
User summary:

RPG - Rage Precognition Grace is a one-page RPG. Characters have three Aspects (Rage, Precognition, and Grace), with values between 0 and 3. Characters also have a number of derived Attributes including Wounds (e.g., hit points) which start at 8; unconsciousness occurs at 0 Wounds and death occurs at -10 Wounds). Characters can use Black Magic (damaging magic) and White Magic (healing magic) once they have found and read a Magic Tome that teaches them how to do it. Characters begin play with an Equipment Package based on Class.

Action checks, known as Tests, use 2d6 plus the appropriate Aspect, with values of eight or higher indicating success ("snake eyes" always fail). Combat supports initiative and characters may perform an attack, move/attack, or move/move action. Melee attacks are based on Rage and missile attacks are based on Grace; spell casting is based on Precognition. Several magic Elixers raise character Aspects when imbibed.

185766.name: Not Dead Yet
185766.description:
From the Introduction:

This is a one-page roleplaying game where the players are survivors of a zombie apocalypse.

185767.description:
Clockwork Fortress and Cave Market are a set of two promotional cards for the 1st edition of City of Iron.
These cards are added to the "E" buildings; that is, they are available to build from the start of the game.
The Cave Market adds one coin to your income for each different type of good you own.
The Clockwork Fortress allows you to change the order of your citizen and military decks each time you refresh that deck.

These cards may also be used with the 2nd edition of City of Iron, in which they are placed above the usual row of buildings and are not removed until they are purchased.
185767.name: City of Iron: Clockwork Fortress and Cave Market Promo

185769.description:
Remember When ... is a family party game for 3-9 players, ages 8 and up. Younger readers are also able to play, as the game is very educational for teaching sentence structure and increasing vocabulary, while being fun at the same time!

The players represent retired super heroes and reformed super villains who have gotten together, years later, to reminisce about their earlier adventures. But, as always happens at occasions like this, each is trying to outdo their peers by bragging about an even more amazing story of what they once did. But the really funny part is that everyone's memories are faulty because they are now going senile, and they're relying on their "friends" to help them fill in the blanks! So while the hero or villain might really have a great story to tell, what comes out of their mouth ends up being VERY different. Each player has two goals - 1) To be the best at helping the other players in remembering correctly, and 2) To come up with your own memory/adventure that your peers agree is the best one of all!

Remember When ... comes with hundreds of unique cards, each with 4 words/phrases on it's 4 sides. There are ZERO repeats, meaning there are over a billion billion different combinations! There are also several blank cards for players to create their own. On the Active Player's turn they are creating a memory with 7 or 8 (if using the optional Orange cards) different cards representing a different part of the memory. 1) WHEN they did this, 2) WHERE they did this, 3) HOW they did this (i.e. Adverb), 4) The ACTION that they took (i.e. Verb), 5) The DESCRIPTION of the object of their memory (i.e. Adjective), 6) The OBJECT of their memory (i.e. Noun), and 7) WHY they took this action. For example, "Remember When ..., while looking for my other sock, in the crowded grocery store, I repeatedly kissed the furry caveman because the Great Conjunction was at hand!?"

But the Active Player does not create this Sentence/Memory from their own cards. The other players are rapidly trying to assist the Active Player by submitting one card each. The Object and the Action Taken are determined first and read out loud, so the players have some context for their card submissions. Once one card of a type/color (i.e. "Blue") has been submitted then another available color must be submitted. As the players submit their cards to the Active Player, face down, they are trying to guess which of those 4 words/phrases the Active Player will actually choose. If they are correct in their guesses then they will get points for "helping".

Once the Active Player has assembled their sentence, scored it for "helping points", then they read the completed sentence aloud (we suggest as dramatically as possible). This is because the other players will be voting on which memory of the evening is the most exciting of all!
185769.name: Remember When ...

185771.name: Gothic Worlds
185771.description:
User summary:

Gothic Worlds presents a setting which begins as a mundane, Medieval world much like our own history. Then a source of magic is introduced and humanity begins to tap into it to alter history and events. The game proposes only one race--humans. Characters select Classes which guide their development. The game provides these Classes: Archer, Barbarian, Black Mage, Blue Mage, Green Mage, Knight, Red Mage, and White Mage. Each color of Mage aligns with a "school" or sphere of magic. Characters also have Fortune Points which are gained and spent during play.

The game uses standard d6 but proposes a special use called d6% where 2d6 of differing colors re rolled and one is used for the tens position and one for the ones position, yielding a discontinuous 2-digit number from 11, 12, 13...to 64, 65, 66.

Combat is resolved by using a character's Combat Stat with a multiplier and trying to "roll under" this with d6%; the "to hit" roll also determines hit location if it is successful. The game includes a magic system keyed to Class, equipment lists, and a character sheet with hit locations.

185772.name: No King of England: A Solitaire Game of the Hundred Years War (1337-1453)
185772.description:
BACKGROUND: NO KING OF ENGLAND is a semi-historical simulation of the Hundred Years War. The Game begins shortly after Charles IV of France dies in 1328. The Queen of England, Isabella of France, is unable to claim the French throne for herself, and has claimed it for her son, Edward III. France rejects the claim, maintaining that Isabella could not transmit a right that she did not possess. The Player represents the House of Plantagenet with the ambition of attaining control of France. As the Commander of English Forces, you must control a significant number of French Cities and Towns before the last Campaign Card is played.

GAME OBJECTIVE: Player takes command of the English Forces. The Player’s Objective is to attempt to control at least 10 French Cities and 12 French Towns before the last Campaign Card is Played. If the French control London and Portsmouth at the end of their Turn, the French win. If the last Campaign Card was played and Player does not control 10 Cities and 12 Towns, France Wins.

GAME FEATURES: NO KING OF ENGLAND features lots of colorful game counters of various Combat Units including Nobles, Knights, Archers, Handgunners and Cannon. English Nobles will gather their Forces and move on the Map in a strategic manner along rout lines of key settlements (and Naval Lanes). Combat is resolved in a tactical manner that includes individual combat between Champion Knights and Archers. The game, also, includes an eventual appearance by Joan of Arc.

NO KING OF ENGLAND can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net

185773.name: Phantasy Star: Ragol's Curse
185773.description:
From the game document:

This work is meant as a salute to the computer game upon which it is based. It is an unsanctioned, unauthorized homage, a parody of Phantasy Star Online: Blue Burst.

User summary:

The game adapts a Computer Roleplaying Game to a tabletop format. It assumes that players will not be familiar with standard tabletop gaming. Character creation involves selecting a Race, Selecting a Guild, and generating starting Attributes. The seven Attributes are meant to mimic the computer game. Characters also develop a MAG (Mobile Android Guardian), as in the computer game. The Guild selected determines which Techniques a character will have for use during combat. Advanced Techniques use a fairly simple tree structure for access. The remainder of the document discusses missions (adventures), how actions are resolved, and how combat occurs. These mechanics are fairly simple and typical of tabletop games in general.

185774.description:
How To Kill A Spider is an easy to learn, fast paced, trick-taking style card game with a dark and hilarious twist.

We were inspired to make a game we could play with our friends and family, having easy-to-learn familiar mechanics, but with a twist! How To Kill A Spider fits in the traditional genre of games such as Spades and other trick-taking games, with a bit of inspired "Take That!" flavor from games like Fluxx and Munchkin.

In "How To Kill A Spider" players take on the role of roommates, trying to clear their house of those horrible home invaders by using an assortment of completely practical household weaponry! The roommate with the most spider cards in their Squash Pile at the end of 3 rounds is our winner! But be careful, if the house is infested with more spiders than the winner's Squash Pile, all players lose!

The base game comes with 130 cards, including 10 "SWAT" expansion pack cards that modify the game further for additional variance and mechanics.
185774.name: How to Kill a Spider

185775.name: Relic Trader: The Pardoner's Game
185775.description:
You are a FRAUD!

No, really, you are. But you're one of the best in London. You could convince a legless man to buy a pair of shoes. You could spit in a jar and sell it for medicine. You could sell a widow a charm to increase her husband's fertility. You rush forth where honest men fear to tread. Where other people see the love and joy of God, you see a chance for a profit.

Using your unscrupulous skills - and a copy of the Legenda Aurea - you work your way through the streets of medieval London, taking trash and turning it into treasure. You're just trying to help, of course, and if they're happy, who are you to let a little thing like honesty interfere with that? Why, you're doing a public service!

Your ultimate goal is to give up the life of deceit on the streets, and instead, become a lay clerk at St. Paul's Cathedral. Fortunately, you know where you can purchase, ahem, volunteer for the job. For the price of a proper bribe, why, it's a steal! Sadly, there are other citizens who share your desires, and they plan to take the job first. The first one to acquire the cash gets the job.

The object of the game is to roll dice to travel around the board, trying to collect Relic cards from the corner squares, and then sell the Relic cards at the markets. Gameplay is based on rolling dice for movement, and drawing an Action card at most squares. Action cards will affect the value of relics, the gain and loss of shillings (money), and the possibility of getting arrested. The winner is the first player to acquire thirteen shillings and return to the corner square, St. Paul's Cathedral.

185776.name: Hunters of Alexandria: A Swords & Sandals Roleplaying Game
185776.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hunters of Alexandria is a roleplaying game in an urban fantasy setting, but one set in the ancient rather than the modern world.

Players take on the role of members of a small monster hunting organisation, the Venatores, in the city of Alexandria, in the year 1AD. The Emperor Augustus rules Rome, and Alexandria has been under direct Roman rule for the last 30 years. Monsters, ghosts, sorcerers and things that go bump in the night all threaten the people of Alexandria.

In this 110 page A5 book we present complete rules for character generation and play, and details of this mythic and monstrous version of ancient Alexandria, including different factions at play in the city, the geography of Alexandria, supernatural beasts, scenario seeds and a complete introductory scenario.

The book is designed to be lightweight and easy to absorb. It is suitable for immediate sandbox play (with a full cast of supporting non-player characters detailed as well as the city itself) and also includes a full introductory scenario (Saviour Gods). It comes with four example characters so you can start running the game after reading.

Hunters of Alexandria in a Nutshell


The year is 1AD or 753AUC, 753 years after the foundation of Rome.
Egypt has been under Roman rule for a generation, since Augustus the first Roman Emperor deposed the last of the Greek Pharaohs, Cleopatra. Alexandria is the capital.
Alexandria is a big city, with nearly a million people (this is breathtakingly huge for the ancient world). It is highly cosmopolitan, with Romans, Greeks, Egyptians, Jews being the main peoples here.
Monsters and magic are real. Monsters are similar to those from myths and legends, though not all the stories are literally true. Magic is subtle rather than flashy.
Most people believe in monsters and magic, though they have seldom if ever witnessed either, and dismiss the majority of the stories as nonsense. They are correct in this, but do not realise the extent of the supernatural world.
The main gods worshipped here are typically Egyptian (Isis being the main example), a syncretic combination of Greek and Egyptian (the chief being Serapis), or Roman. People are increasingly seeing the older gods as facets of the Roman gods, but the priesthoods of Serapis and Isis resist this idea.
The Musaeum of Alexandria is a great source of scholarship, with a vast library, but isn’t what it was in pre-Roman times.


You belong to an organisation known as the Venatores, meaning Hunters.

Your job is to hunt down supernatural threats to the city.





The Fortune System

The game uses the Fortune System, a light version of the Fate rules , influenced by the Jadepunk RPG. It provides a straightforward approach to resolve tests and conflicts in historic fantasy settings.

Pre-generated player characters

The game comes with four pre-generated player characters so you can pick up and play!

Introductory Scenario – Saviour Gods

The Great Lighthouse of Alexandria is a shining beacon in the night, which guides sailors safely into port. It is also a highly magical place, thanks to rituals performed by its architect when it was built. It is a beacon of light that prevents the forces of darkness from invading from the sea. Miraculously, given all the violence of Julius Caesar’s arrival forty six years ago and Augustus’s subsequent toppling of the Ptolemaic Dynasty thirty years ago, the Tower has endured. Now a dark force within the city wants to see the tower destroyed, so that powerful masters may secretly avoid its revealing gaze and settle in the city.

Saviour Gods is an introductory scenario for Hunters of Alexandria. It is intended to give a firm grounding for both players and games masters in the setting and the rules.

185777.name: The Unicorn's Crown
185777.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Unicorn’s Crown is designed for first level characters, and will take them to level three by the end. The encounters are all designed to be run for a party ranging in size from 3 to 7 players.

A crime has been committed, a very personal theft from the Crown Prince of Taralos. Our heroes must track down the perpetrators and unravel the mystery and conspiracy that lies behind the theft. They will interview witnesses, dive beneath the streets and track fugitives through forests and hills. They will face natural hazards, traps, and villainous gem gnolls before finally the truth is revealed and the future of the kingdom lies in their hooves.

To Found an Empire explores the world of Everglow just before the formation of the Pony Empire. Our heroes will see the Kingdoms and tribes that came together to form it and maybe even experience that transformation themselves.

185778.name: Prometheus Blade
185778.description:
User summary:

Prometheus Blade uses a unique method of Attributes, with each score being derived from (and tied to) a specific body part (Head, Chest, Arms, and Legs). Characters have one "Below Average" body part, two "Average" body parts, and one "Above Average" body part, where scores range from 2-4 accordingly. Characters learn Skills derived from specific Body Parts and their Values.

All actions compare an "Action Value" to an "Opposition Value". The Action Value is derived from the Body Part and possible Skill. The Opposition Value is set by the GM in the case of unopposed actions, or by the opponent's values in the case of opposed actions. These two values are cross-referenced on a matrix table yielding a target number for success, against which 2d6 (for Skilled checks) or 1d6+1 (for unskilled checks) are rolled and summed. The matrix values range from 3 (exceptionally easy) to 12 (exceptionally difficult).

185779.description:
44 Kickstarter Exclusive Kings and Bears Cards!

1x Kaptain Koala
1x Krazy Koala
3x Graverobbear
3x Cheerleadbear
3x Streetfightbear
3x Ghost Obearative
3x Quarterbear
3x Beerbrewbear
3x Cybearpunk
3x Reapbear
3x Headbangbear
3x Abearigine
3x Abracadabear
3x Camembear
3x Campbear
3x Bearcycler
185779.name: Karnivore Koala: Graverobbear Expansion

185780.name: Powers-Brawl
185780.description:
User summary:

Powers-Brawl, a Miniatures Combat RPG, primarily focuses on tactical miniatures combat but also provides a campaign mode for roleplaying. The core functions work best during tactical combat.

Characters can be hand-crafted, or, optionally, randomly generated. Characters have four Values--two Action Values (Attack and Survive) and two Opposition Values (Evade and Damage). Values range from -1 to 7+, with an average adult human running 2-3 and an average Super Hero running 3-4. During combat, the attacker rolls 2d6 + Attack Value against the Defenders Evade +7. Exceeding the defense results in a hit that yield damage. Damage is calculated by a similar roll based on other Values. When damage is suffered a character's Value is reduced by one.

Characters also have one or more Powers that are arranged in five groups. These include stand "super hero" powers and abilities and, obviously, many powers influence combat and damage.

Characters can gain Experience Points and Levels during campaign play. Levels in turn yield improved Powers. The rules also provide basic mechanisms to be used only in role-play mode, including storytelling, origins, and secret identities. The primary role-playing concession, however, involves four additional Skills granted to characters to reflect abilities beyond combat: Dexterity, Perception, Strength, and Willpower.

185782.name: Xceptional
185782.description:
User summary:

The RPG is produced in accordance with Rob Lang's 'Free Guide to Organizing Your RPG'. Character creations begins with selecting a Profile, then generating Ability Scores, of which there are three: Rage, Precognition, and Grace. Characters next select a Class (Brawler, Shooter, or Mentalist) which gives access to a Skill set from which characters select. Characters may gain experience and improve.

The game uses a "d5" dice mechanism, where a standard d6 is used with results of "6" treated as "0". A "5x5" roll is two d5 multiplied together, yielding 0-25 in a discontinuous sequence. Combat rolls use "5x5" relative to Combat Rank. On a hit, the opponent uses Defensive Action to "control the hit"--again with a "5x5" roll relative to Combat Rank. Sustained damage results in an Ability Score being reduced by one--if any score reaches zero the character falls Unconscious. If the hit is "controlled" the defender selects the reduced Ability Score, otherwise the attacker selects the Ability Score.

185784.description:
Aeric is a very peculiar knight. He was raised by pandas, and so believes to be a panda himself. He fights with a panda's true courage and cuddliness.

Aeric is a single-character expansion to Arcadia Quest with the special ability: "Rolls +2 dice on defense rolls against Ranged attacks."
185784.name: Arcadia Quest: Aeric

185785.name: Rage, Precognition, Grace
185785.description:
User summary:

Rage, Precognition, Grace, was originally released as part of a 24-Hour RPG contest as a one-page RPG. It was later re-worked and re-released in this expanded format.

Characters have three Base Traits: Rage, Precognition, and Grace. Characters select a Race which grants bonus points into a Pool; Base Traits start at a value of 8 but can be varied between 0-23 (the Combat Table matrix only runs to 20, however). Combat is resolved by comparing the Attacker's Combat Value (Grace + Weapon Skill + 7) against the Defender's Combat Value (Grace + Weapon Skill + 7) on a matrix table to obtain a target number between 3 and 12. The attacker must roll 2d6 and meet or exceed the target number.

Characters have a variety of Skills available and also may cast several Spells. Characters do not have a Class but do have a Type which determines (limits) some abilities. The rules conclude with a character sheet.

185786.description:
Farfalla is a half-elf maiden posessed of supernatural empathy. Daughter to an important elf-lord, she traveled to Arcadia in a diplomatic mission and must now choose whether to stand among the courageous humans to help them or return to her noble kindred as duty requires.

Farfalla is a single-character expansion to Arcadia Quest with the special ability: "When using one of her Attack cards, she may exhaust any Close Hero's Attack card instead."
185786.name: Arcadia Quest: Farfalla

185787.name: The Lost City of Barakus: Iconic Characters
185787.description:
User summary:

A collection of ready-to-play characters for use with either the Pathfinder or Swords & Wizardry version of The Lost City of Barakus.

185788.name: Heroica: Character Cards
185788.description:
A set of 22 Heroica character cards for use with the Heroica game system - all printed in German.

The cards include:


6 Good characters (Barbarian, Wizard, Ranger, Druid, Rogue and Knight)
4 Potion Cards (each card lists 4 Potions)
4 Monster Cards (each card lists 10 Monsters, back and front)
4 Weapon Cards (each card lists 6 Weapons, back and front)


Cards provided in a foil-style bag.

4 Treasure Cards (Scepter, Helmet, Crystal and Chalice)




The cards come in a foil pack.

The cards can be used to:
1 - Randomize hero selection at the start of the game.
2 - Provide players with handy reference cards for Potions, Weapons, Treasures and Monster strength values.
3 - Face down treasure cards may be used as an alternative end game goal instead of using the assigned treasure in a game. May also be used for random treasures in fan made dungeons.

185789.name: Mombie
185789.description:
A simple maze game with an evil twist!

Source: The Game Website.

185790.description:
This surprise personality card is made especially for the 10th anniversary of Quined Games. On the cards’ art you can see Arno, the founder and owner of Quined Games. During the day he is a lawyer and during the evening he is an editor. Enjoy playing with this character, here are the rules on how to use him.

The Lawyer may immediately buy a parcel not owned by any player. He pays the normal price. In addition, nobody can contest the lawyer from buying a parcel. In case of a duel with the Lawyer
for buying a parcel, the challenging cowboy goes back to the personal reserve of this player, before the duel is resolved. For all other actions, duels against the lawyer are resolved as
usual. Cash limit : $60.

The Editor publishes a story inspired by your success. At the end of the income phase (round 1/2/3/4), you win a victory point for every $5 / $10 / $15 / $20 of income from all your buildings, rounded up. You do not earn points on income from the attacks of other players buildings or on the money other players would have robbed you. Example: in round 2, you get a total income of 33$ from your buildings, so you earn 4 victory points. Cash limit: $40.
185790.name: Carson City: The Lawyer / Editor

185791.name: Smokaz Challenge
185791.description:
A puzzle game with a twist!

Source: The Game Website.

185792.name: Scribble 2!
185792.description:
Draw dot-to-dot in this race against the clock. Kind of like Scribble, but kind of not. At the end of the game, you’ll receive a grade and banner to put on your site. Enjoy!

Source: The Game Website.

185793.name: GTP Compet
185793.description:
From the back of the box (translated):

GTP Compet brings the entire family together.

Suitable for all ages 6 to adult. It helps everyone learn the initial concepts of solid geometry while having fun and develops logic, dexterity, manual agility and a sense of observation. Educational and of exceptional content with numerous variants.

For two players, you must be the fastest to achieve the challenges imposed by the puzzle or 3D maps.

Solo, you need to build cubes of different sizes and difficulties from thousands of possible combinations.

185794.name: Scribble
185794.description:
Connect the dots as fast as you can, using your magical crayon!

Source: The Game Website.

185796.name: Innovation: Artifacts of History
185796.description:
Artifacts of History is the fourth expansion to Innovation. Artifacts of History features unique artifacts from the ages, such as the Declaration of Independence. These cards feature very powerful dogma effects, but are difficult to wield.

Artifacts of History is simpler than the other expansions released to date, Unlike the other expansions, there are no major new mechanics on the cards. Instead, the new artifact cards are difficult to acquire but have very powerful effects. The artifacts are especially good for players who are behind.

There are a few minor new mechanics. One is the compel effect. This effect is similar to the demand effect of the base game, except that it affects players who have more icons of a given type rather than fewer.

boardgamecompilation: Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Beach Card Mini Expansion
Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Beast Cards
Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Discovery Tokens
Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Dreadful adventure on the King Kong Island
Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Hunting Dog
Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Sailor character
Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Tracing Doctor Livingstone
Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Trait Cards I
Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Trait Cards II
Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Treasure Island Junior
185797.description:
A collection of previously available promos plus a new adventure for "Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island".

Contents:

a new character "Schiffsmaat"
50 deluxe resource marker
stickers for action marker
new scenarios: "Wo ist Dr. Livingstone?", "King Kong", "Die Schatzinsel junior" and "Der Naturforscher".
new beasts
7 new discoveries
10 trait cards
scenario extras: newspaper, playing cards and letters
185797.name: Robinson Crusoe: Schatzkiste
boardgameexpansion: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
boardgamefamily: Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 128

185798.name: Memory (2007)
185798.description:
Repeat after me…

Source: The Game Website.

185799.name: Between The Lines
185799.description:
Draw a line for the ‘s’ star to the ‘f’ star. Making sure you stay ‘between the lines’

Source: The Game Website.

185800.name: [ Vorticube ]
185800.description:
Collect cubes and avoid the explosive mines to work your way through colourful levels and set a highscore!

This game is incredibly graphic intensive. Please set the quality to low via the pause menu for older machines. :)

Source: The Game Website.

185801.name: Palantir
185801.description:
Lots of multicolored balls on the playing field are scattered in mess. You are to complete the chains and make them disappear to let another balls arise on their places..

Source: The Game Website.

185802.name: PC Handbook (2005 Version)
185802.description:
From the introduction:

Future Shadows is a science fiction / fantasy adventure role-playing game. In the Future Shadows game, participants play the roles of people in a sci-fi / Fantasy galaxy that has been decimated in a galactic war.

[Future Shadows] is your chance to play a character that is completely different from your own real life identity. You can chose to be whatever it is that you desire most, or find appealing at the time.

Future Shadows is a space opera. It is filled with the politics of the Empire, the strong influences and possible corruption of Mega Corporations, the ruin of war, and the dark ages of lost technology and recession. Optional rules allow other setting influences of hacking, psionics, mecha, vehicles, and space ships. FS is very customizable to almost any setting.

User summary:

The PC Handbook (2005 Version) contains the bulk of the system rules and is intended for all players and the GM. The book itself is available for free download as a series of seven PDF files, each file representing one chapter in the book. It is much reduced from the previously released version, with the removal of materials into other books.

185803.name: PC Handbook (2002 Version)
185803.description:
From the introduction:

Future Shadows takes place within the Milky Way Galaxy in the 35th century. In this fictional future universe the Empire rules the majority of the explored galaxy, uniting the majority of known races. The core of the Empire is densely populated, and is spread ever thinner to the colonies and fringe worlds of farthest reached of explored space. The Empire is filled with competing races and mega corporations that spar with politics, violence, and philosophy. These spars have left many scattered through out the Empire, unemployed and destitute. They are called the dispossessed and live very meagerly sustaining themselves on the Empires charity.

Beyond the Empire are several races that have chosen not to be part of the Empire. Nearer the center of the galaxy the Koranda have invaded from another Galaxy. From beyond our dimension there is ancient threat that seeps through the rifts.

Living in the shadows of this mixture of events, trying to survive and thrive is the core of the adventures you will find in Future Shadows.

185804.name: GM Handbook
185804.description:
User summary:

The GM Handbook is distributed as a series of nine PDF files, each file comprising a chapter in the book. The book has no introduction and starts with GM information on Mega Corporations, continuing with Colonies, Clans, Races, the Galaxy, Semi Intelligent Races, Fauna, the Koranda, and Dimensional Races. Sections receive unequal treatment.

185805.name: Supplement Rules
185805.description:
User summary:

Supplement Rules is distributed as a series of eight separate PDF files, each file comprising a topical chapter. Each chapter generally presents topical equipment lists with tech level and cost, plus any rules needed to support the equipment. The major topics are: Cybernetics, Droids, Power Armor, Vehicles, Mecha (similar to Power Armor), Vessels, Psyber Space, and Psionics. Coverage is fairly consistent.

185806.name: Game Master Guide
185806.description:
User summary:

Game Master Guide is distributed as eight separate PDF files, each file consisting of a single topical chapter. The book consists primarily of advice for GMs in how to handle specific areas of the game. Although it specifically is addressed to Future Shadows gaming the book contains much general good advice for any GM. The topics include: Your First Game, Game Mastering, Alignment Rules, Tech Levels (concise), Law Levels (concise), Classes: Archetypes & NPCs, New Races, and Adventure Design.

185807.name: Tabletop Dungeon
185807.description:
From the introduction:

The Heroes are trapped in the monster infested, ever changing, dungeon of the Lich King! They must find the exit and escape before the Lich King summons an undefeatable Dragon to kill them all!

User comments:

Bulk of document consists of print-and-play components, primarily paper maps to construct the dungeon and paper counters representing the players and various monsters. Game play consists of placing character tokens on a starting map, surviving combats and collecting treasure, and then moving into new areas looking for the dungeon exit. Game provides four character "types" (Wizard, Archer, Barbarian, Knight) and three monster "types" (Orc, Goblin, Dragon).

185808.name: Fuzzy Knights: The Lite Edition
185808.description:
From the introduction:

The Lite Edition is the bare bones format of the much larger Fuzzy Knights RPG. It is free to download, copy and distribute to your friends. It is meant to whet your appetite for the Full version of the game, which has more complete rules, background, humor, adventure, maps, figures and fun!

Approximately one in every ten thousand stuffed toys becomes a Fuzzy. Even before recorded history, they were found in many different forms: from grotesque dead animal carcasses held together with sticks, to spiritual figures of clay and stone.

185809.name: Hammer 2 Reloaded
185809.description:
User Summary

This is a Unity game that includes:

Scripts

Thirdperson character controller
Camera system including camera shakes
Destructible buildings tech
Bullets, explosions and area damage
Enemy and pickup spawners
Enemy, boss and enemy vehicles behavior
Controllable vehicles and turrets
Ambient system
Options and settings
Achievements
Streamable preloading for web player
Global and local data management
Player progress saving and loading
Full game flow, pausing, retrying, unlocking
New scalabe Unity GUI
Flexible button and navigation system
Minimap system
Shop for ingame currency
Localization
XGUI 2d helper scripts
Xbox 360 controller support

185810.name: GURPS Action 4: Specialists
185810.description:
From the publisher:

Time to Bring in the Experts

Yes, GURPS Action is back with a vengeance!

Action heroes might be stereotyped, but they rarely fit into nice, neat boxes. Studios spend big bucks making sure we all know exactly what's special about the hero of their latest blockbuster. While Action 1: Heroes and Action 3: Furious Fists are up to the challenge of creating characters who stand out, there are times when 250-point templates aren't quite the right tool for the job.

That's when you call in Action 4: Specialists. Its modular design system lets you pick and choose from over 100 areas of expertise to create exactly the right hero for the mission, while its systematic advice on filing off rough edges and filling in holes gives you a lean, mean action machine.

But that's not all!

This system is also useful for:


Running Action at lower- and higher-than-usual power levels, from 125 points on up.
"Leveling-up" characters, no matter how they were designed.
Quickly designing NPCs, be they Allies, generic supporting cast, or bad guys.


Because when the going gets tough, you send in the professionals!

185811.description:
EcoChains is a multiplayer card game about climate change -- life and the struggle for survival in a rapidly warming Arctic. Players build food chains as they learn about Arctic ecosystems and how humans impact the environment (e.g. how carbon pollution and diminishing sea ice can impact Arctic species). The game was produced by Jogolabs and designed by a team of environmental scientists, educators and game designers.

Gameplay is simple: Sea Ice cards form the base of each player's food web. Each player builds food chains by connecting various Arctic species cards including polar bear, walrus, ringed seal and narwhal. Event cards such as carbon pollution occur, which melt sea ice and cause some animals to migrate or die. Players can also play Action cards in order to help protect their food chains. The player who keeps the most animals alive wins. Goal cards also provide additional Victory points.

http://www.ecochainsgame.com
185811.name: EcoChains: Arctic Crisis

185812.description:
Inconceivable: Kingdom at War is an intense microgame in which you must strategically read your opponent(s) and respond accordingly. Each player controls a part of the remains of a broken kingdom, fighting to restore stability to the fallen empire. With four battle cards in hand, you must choose: Should you play your Knight? Your Archer? Do you call in your Sorcerer, or save it for a future round? It all depends on the action of your foes, so do not be deceived by their trickery.

Inconceivable is a 2-3 player game that lasts about 10-20 minutes on average. Each player has 4 warrior cards, which can be seen below. There are 18 loot cards that are mixed up and placed face-down, creating the playing field. On each turn, there can be anywhere from one to three rounds to win these loot cards. The progression of each turn is a mystery; so be strategic!
185812.name: Inconceivable: Kingdom at War

185813.name: Murderer's Row
185813.description:
Deal 10 cards in a row. Kill 9 of them.

Each turn consists of activating a card and resolving its effect. Play proceeds until all cards except one have been eliminated or until no further moves are possible.

185814.description:
City of Ideologies is a strategic board game in a futuristic setting for two up to four players.

Humanity had to leave Earth centuries ago and travels in search of a new home in a huge city by the vastness of space. Players assume the role of leaders who are trying to reshape the city after their vision in an erupting revolution against the old system. For this they must legislate, kindle demonstration, gain influence over the districts of the city and always keep an eye on the mood of the people and the changing game board.

Both the game board, as well as the laws are constantly changing, it is important to keep a cool head, gain advantage through agreements with other players or through own concepts or intrigue to weaken the position of the other players.

City of Ideologies combines different game mechanics: You move protesters across the board, which turns around three times each round, role dice and push your luck, gain influence in districts, use different cards to perform unique actions and at the end of each round, one person is chosen by election of all players who is allowed to change a paragraph / rule mechanism.

Each action may be carried out in various ways. In most cases, they are paid with influence points, which vary from faction to faction depending on their main focus. If a player can not muster enough points for an action, then he can trade with his fellow players. Or he activates a district, which lets him perform the action or pulls a card that allows him to perform the action or uses a person of his faction. Or he changes a paragraph, so that the action costs less points.

The player who collects the most victory-points will win the game after five rounds. The way you collect victory points depends on the one hand on your ideology, which you choose at the beginning of the game. So every player gains victory points in different ways. For example, one player gets a victory point every time he prevents other players actions. Another player collects victory points if the other players give him voluntarily cards or influence points. On the other hand players can gain victory points on certain districts, by cards and paragraphs.

At the end the player will be victorious, who is both the most accurate follower of his ideology, as has also been successful in competitive areas.
185814.name: City of Ideologies

185815.name: The Well of Souls
185815.description:
The objective is to capture the opposition’s sacred book, release one’s captive ancestors and figuratively destroy the captured book at one’s altar.

Mechanically, the game is a roll and move format. Four players are required and the game is played in two teams--The People of Light versus The People of Darkness. Each player takes on an identity.

Game components include, a game board, deck of draw cards for each team, two sets of dice and other parts related to identity, movement and possession of goods.

The game board has an innovation where the end game expands the board by including a middle insert where the end game is played.

185816.name: >>>Dodge
185816.description:
Fixed the bug with respawning
Hate the music? Right click, and turn it off.

Use the mouse to control he blue ball collect the yellow balls but make sure you ‘dodge’ the grey ones. Read instructions before play.

Coding – West-End-Pro
Art – JC-FLASH

Source: The Game Website.

185817.description:
Welcome to the city of Machi Koro. You've just been elected Mayor. Congrats! Unfortunately the citizens have some pretty big demands: jobs, a theme park, a couple of cheese factories and maybe even a radio tower.
