A tough proposition since the city currently consists of a wheat field, a bakery and a single die.

Armed only with your trusty die and a dream, you must grow Machi Koro into the largest city in the region. You will need to collect income from developments, build public works, and steal from your neighbors' coffers. Just make sure they aren't doing the same to you!

Machi Koro is a fast-paced game for 2-4 players. Each player wants to develop the city on his own terms in order to complete all of the landmarks under construction faster than his rivals. On his turn, each player rolls one or two dice. If the sum of the dice rolled matches the number of a building that a player owns, he gets the effect of that building; in some cases opponents will also benefit from your die (just as you can benefit from theirs). Then, with money in hand a player can build a landmark or a new building, ideally adding to the wealth of his city on future turns. The first player to construct all of his landmarks wins!

The Machi Koro: Harbor Expansion injects further excitement into the game that has everyone talking! Want even more fun in your box?! Perhaps ten new establishments, one new starting establishment and two new landmarks will help?
185817.name: Metropolia

185818.name: Jadetech: White Jade
185818.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jadetech: White Jade is the fourth in a six-part supplement series for the Jadepunk: Tales From Kausao City roleplaying game.

In this digital supplement, you will find everything you need to outfit your Jianghu hero with Jadetech devices that utilize white jade. You will also learn the history of white jade, how it is refined, and how it is used in daily life throughout the world. Filled with plot hooks for your games, this is more than just an equipment supplement - it's an add-on for the setting of Jadepunk.

185819.name: Between the Lines
185819.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1–5.

Rival explorers have beaten the Pathfinders to a valuable site in Katapesh, but fortunately most of the riches—including the obscure text the Society sought in the first place—have ended up in the capitol’s extensive bazaars. What is at first a routine shopping trip spirals out of control as the PCs uncovers the writing’s secret past—and secret messages.

185820.name: Six Seconds to Midnight
185820.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 3–7.

A strange confluence of circumstances leaves the researchers of Uringen understaffed and in need of able-bodied assistants. Conveniently, recent Pathfinder Society experiments call for a rare reagent found only in that area, and the two organizations have negotiated a mutually beneficial deal. Can the PCs reach the secluded settlement in time to witness this extraordinary event—and handle the phenomenon’s aftermath?

185821.name: The Bronze House Reprisal
185821.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 5–9.

A recent assault on the Pathfinder Society has renewed hostilities with the Aspis Consortium, and clues left behind point to one of its masterminds: the gold agent Maiveer Sloan. By infiltrating one of the Consortium’s artifact-smuggling operations, the PCs can sabotage their rivals’ criminal operations and send a clear message: No attack will go unanswered.

185822.name: The Ironbound Schism
185822.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 7–11.

The cataclysmic Earthfall shattered the ancient Thassilonian civilization, and like its slumbering runelords who fled the destruction, many ruins lie hidden. The Ironbound Archipelago was once part of Edasseril, kingdom of envy, and word has reached the Pathfinder Society that an ancient ruin has emerged on the isle of Flintyreach. Can the PCs gain the local half-orcs’ trust and brave the resident giants’ wrath to secure this archaeological treasure?

185823.name: School of Spirits
185823.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1–5.

Seven years ago, Pathfinders entered Absalom’s shattered Precipice Quarter in pursuit of a ruby ring but also rescued a strange survivor. She has since grown to adulthood and exhibited a rebellious spirit connected to the ruined school where the Pathfinders found her. The woman’s family has contacted the Society, hoping that its agents can escort her back to the haunted site and unravel the Drownyard’s relentless mysteries.

185824.name: Phantom Phenomena
185824.description:
From publisher blurb:

A series of six Quests designed for 1st-level characters.

Bizarre phenomena have tormented the people of southeastern Ustalav for decades, and these events become stronger and more dangerous every year. Hoping to uncover the origins of these flashes of red lightning and spectral hauntings, Dr. Quolorum from the Sincomakti School of Sciences has set out with a team of able-bodied assistants. Can the PCs help the professor unlock the secret that dwells above Lantern Lake?

Phantom Phenomena includes six, 1-hour adventures that take the PCs to a superstitious village, a lightning-scarred woodland, an ancient Kellid monolith, a haunted manor, an occult university, and finally into the storm-choked mountains. Experience the adventures in any order to create a unique story.

185825.name: Fane of Fangs
185825.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Quest designed for level 5 characters written by Nathan King.

Long ago, the daemonic harbinger Anogetz nearly conquered Southern Fangwood with an army of mad beasts, but a miracle from the hunter god Erastil staved off disaster. Thieves made off with the holy relic keeping the daemoic energies sealed, and now it's up to the PCs to return the relic before the evil force awakens and marches once more.

185826.name: Trouble in Tamran
185826.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1-5.

Less than a decade ago, the Pathfinder Society established a lodge in Nirmathas, an act that infuriated the nation's expansionist rival Molthune. The latter outlawed the Society soon after, and ever since Pathfinders have relied on smugglers like the Varisian entrepreneur Guaril Karela to slip supplies past the Molthuni blockade for both the lodge and the Society's war-torn neighbors. Something has intercepted those shipments. Can the PCs uncover the culprit and save the Society's reputation in Nirmathas?

Content in "Trouble in Tamran" also ties into a special metaplot element from Pathfinder Society Special #6–98: Serpents Rise. Players who have completed that special event are encouraged to bring its Chronicle sheet when playing this adventure.

185827.name: To Judge a Soul, Part 1: The Lost Legacy
185827.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 3–7.

When a samsaran dies, he is reborn again with few memories of his past lives. The cycle continues until he has earned a righteous place in the afterlife. After years of service and lifetimes of accomplishment, Venture-Captain Bakten nears the end of his noble existence and has begun investigating his past lives as a means of understanding Tian Xia's rich history. However, he cannot complete his research alone, and only with the PCs' assistance can they decipher the region's past.

"The Lost Legacy" is the first scenario in the two-part To Judge a Soul campaign arc. It is followed by [Pathfinder Society Scenario #7-08: To Judge a Soul, Part 2: Karma Reclaimed] and is intended to be played in order.

185828.name: The Sun Below: Sleeping Lady
185828.description:
From publisher blurb:

A banished power fights to return to the Ninth World.

A fallen moon of The Sun Below begins to stir.

The Knocker at the Door begins to awake.

A Numenera adventure for all tiers.

49 page adventure for all tiers, 16 page bestiary, new numenera, dozens of GM Intrusions, and player handouts.

Who is the Sleeping Lady? What’s in the numenera mines? What is knock, knock, knocking at the door? Hang onto your minds and bodies, because secrets of Orb Mountain are about to be revealed!

185829.name: Creepy Comic Conversion Issue 1: The Case of the Painted Beast
185829.description:
From publisher blurb:

A prize-winning piece of artwork has been irreplaceably damaged, and the badly-injured night watchman claims the vandal wasn't human! Was the assault and destruction caused by a disgruntled losing artist? Or is there something more nefarious – and deadly – stalking the contest judges?

The “Creepy Comic Conversion” series brings those classic horror comics of the ‘50s and ‘60s back to life for the CRYPTWORLD roleplaying game! The front half of each zine presents an original terrifying tale from a long-forgotten classic horror comic. Then, in the back, you’ll find the story fully fleshed out and statted into a horrific adventure ready for a frightening evening of gaming!

“The Case of the Painted Beast” originally appeared in EERIE, Oct-Nov., 1951, Vol. 1, No. 3, by Avon Periodicals. Scans provided courtesy of The Digital Comic Museum at www.digitalcomicmuseum.com.

185830.description: The Marvel Dice Masters: Uncannny X-men Playmat has spots for all cards used on your team, basic action cards, life counter, and dice spots for your team.
185830.name: Marvel Dice Masters: Uncanny X-Men – Playmat

185831.name: Dragon Beetle
185831.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new creature to use in any d100 setting.

Dragons will sometimes over the course of many generations breed these dangerous insects to protect their treasure hordes and to harass local communities. Fiercly loyal, the Dragon Beetle will serve no other master and will go on destructive campaigns if their dragon lord is ever killed.

185832.name: Galactic Science Fiction Adventures
185832.description:
From the introduction:

Galactic Adventures is a character driven game system. That is to say that all of the rules are derived from a core set of rules that are used to define the capabilities of the characters who inhabit the setting. These core rules cover the development of character backgrounds and the growth of skills through training and experience and the use of skills to accomplish tasks.

User summary:

Action resolution utilizes a modified percentage of success target with the player "rolling under" their target. The rules use "a wide variety of voluntary modifiers" to make success less likely in the event of what would otherwise be automatic success (but the success, if achieved, will be more spectacular). The rules present a series of tiered difficulties .

Characters have "Statistics" (Coordination, Discipline, Endurance, Logic, Perception, Reflexes, Strength, and Talent) which are generated with d100, adding 40 to results that are under 41. Characters then spend point to purchase Skills, select a Career (much like Traveller) and engage in "lifepath" character generation within their Career(s).

185833.name: Infinity RPG Quickstart
185833.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Quickstart gives you an introduction to the 2d20 system, a short adventure, 4 pre-generated characters and an overview of the Infinity universe.

185834.name: Confrontation at Candlekeep
rpg: Dungeons & Dragons (5th Edition, Playtest & Promotional Docs)
185834.description:
Publisher blurb:

Candlekeep is under siege, and it needs adventurers to help protect it! Heed the call to defend the legendary monastery and stand against the tide of evil.


From the introduction:

Confrontation at Candlekeep™ is a D&D® Next adventure designed for four to six 2nd-level characters. This event is intended to be playable in two hours and is designed to be run in stores and at conventions.

185835.name: GAMERS: The Generic Six-Letter System
185835.description:
User summary:

GAMERS was intended to be a generic, universal system with several genre-specific implementations, including: "Agents", "Fright", "Heroic", "Spacer", and "Waster". Only "Spacer" received some (very minor) development--all of the genre implementations remained essentially conceptual. GAMERS itself is quite usable as a generic system capable of supporting any genre.

GAMERS uses a single resolution system for actions, with a "Difficulty" stated for the action and a modified 2d6 rolled against it. Players must exceed the Difficulty with the roll. Combat works essentially the same--however, optional rules for an advanced form of combat also are provided.

Characters have Traits divided into Attributes, Features, Quirks, and Skills. Attributes and Features range from 2-12 (in exceptional cases, as high as 15), Skills range from -2 to +4, and Quirks have no rating. Attributes are randomly generated with 2d6 and include: Grit, Awareness, Mind, Endurance, Reflexes, and Strength. Attribute scores above 9 are indicated with letters: A, B, C, D, E, and F, for 10-15. Features include License, People, Psyche, Status, Technology, and Walth--various campaign may or may not use any or all of these Features. A massive Quirks table is provided and Quirks randomly are generated using 3d6 and reading the results in order, yielding 111, 112...665, 666 in a discontinuous range. Skills start at a default level of -2. Skills are placed into categories and randomly are generated.

185836.description:
This expansion adds historical battles related to the Persian wars (499 – 449 BC), to the Persians vs Greeks wars and to the Peloponnesus war (1st period: 431 – 421 BC) between Athens and Sparta.

There will be 90 unit cards (24 different) belonging to Athens, Sparta, Persia and other Greek poleis and mercenaries:
- Persia: Melophores guard, Sparabaras archers, Takabara mercenaries, Archers with shields, Sicklers, Usubari Dromedaries, Asabari Cavalry, Pasti Infantry and Persian War Chariots (stretch goal).
- Sparta: Hippeis Cavalry (stretch goal), Spartan Hoplites, Helots infantry, Helots slingers and Spartan Cavalry.
- Athens: Hoplites, hoplites attendants, Scythian Archers, Athenian Cavalry and Peltasts (stretch goal).
- Greek mercenaries or allies: Peripolos, Toxotes Archers, Thorakitai, Theban sacred battalion (stretch goal) and Boeotian Hoplites.
185836.name: ONUS! Greeks & Persians

185837.description:
With this expansion you will be able to play with scenery and its new set of rules for sieging, incendiary projectiles, and more…

It contains different types of terrain like woods, hills, rivers (depicted in tiles with several different drawings) and landmarks like towns, bridges, rams, wood/stone fortress sections, barricades, fire counters, assault towers, and more!
185837.name: ONUS! Terrain & Fortresses

185838.name: Gamma World D6
185838.description:
User summary:

This intriguing adaptation of TSR's Gamma World uses a streamlined version of West End Games' D6 mechanics. Characters have Stats and Skills. Difficult and opposed actions are rolled against a Difficulty Number. Die rolls of 6 "explode" into another additive roll. Characters also can earn and spend Luck Points to influence narrative action. Combat works essentially the same way except there are several special situations which provide modifiers.

Characters have four Stats (Dexterity, Knowledge, Perception, and Strength) among which they divide a 12d6 dice pool. Stats must start with 2d6 to 4d6 allocated. Characters have a separate pool of 7d6 to allocate among selected Skills, which must range from 1d6 to 2d6 at creation. Characters also have mutations which do various oddball things--some even are useful.

185839.name: D20 Omega World/GammaWorld: Master's of the Earth Campaign Setting
185839.description:
User summary:

D20 Omega World/GammaWorld is an adaptation of the d20 Version of Gamma World and an extensive article appearing in Polyhedron #153 (Omega World by Jonathan Tweet). It includes numerous revisions and changes.

From the introduction:

Game Premise:
The Omega World/GammaWorld begins approximately 200 years after The Black Days, which is what the present inhabitants of the devastated lands of Omega World/GammaWorld call the short period of plagues and wars that ended the age of man.

185840.name: Gangland Additions
185840.description:
User summary:

The author provides expanded and revised rules based on playtesting and feedback. This requires the original Gangland rules for use. Document includes a FAQ for clarification, expanded equipment lists (including lots of guns), various combat options (for guns), an an examination of the criminal KATTS ("Kill And Take Their Stuff") style of gaming, and a few miscellaneous comments.

185841.name: The Parasite Project
185841.description:
From the introduction:

Human territories are being threatened by an insidious enemy, one that the modern civilization invited without any suspicions. In the sprawling electronic jungle of technological devices, perfectly camouflaged in the environment filled with TV-sets, computers, and microwave ovens, a new species is born. The Parasite.

User summary:

In many respects the game uses a traditional narrative approach to gaming. However, The Parasite Project uses an unusual system to balance play-each character uses a stopwatch and must "run time" when they are performing narration. Prior to the game, an "Incubation Time" is established. If a player exceeds the "Incubation Time" they are overcome by the parasite and they are out of the game. The game also utilizes Hope Tokens that can be gained and spent to influence the narrative.

185843.name: Far Cry: Primal
videogamehonor: 2016 CVA Best Animation of the Year Winner
2016 CVA Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2016 CVA Best Console Game of the Year Nominee
2016 CVA Game of the Year Nominee
185843.description:
User Summary

The next far cry game/spin-off set during the stone age.

185845.name: Dropfleet Commander
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast 005 – 7 Wonders vs Nevermore
185845.description:
Dropfleet Commander is an Orbital Combat game in the Dropzone Commander universe in which the vast majority of your games will take place in orbit above a planet's surface.

A typical gaming table is 4'x4' and will show the surface of a planet rather than the more typical 'starfield' style space combat table. The area covered will be around the size of a large European country/US State.

Weapons range is neither absolute nor fixed. It can change based on the power of your ship's scanners, the enemy ship's signature and the enemy's actions (firing several weapons greatly increases a ships signature for example). Stealth is frequently crucial!

The 2-Player Starter Set for Dropfleet Commander includes:

- The Full Dropfleet Commander Rulebook, and Fast Play Sheets,
- UCM and Scourge Frigate and Cruiser Sprues, (with construction guides),
- Innovative Dropfleet Commander flight stands,
- Double sided fold out map,
- City markers,
- Token sheet,
- Tapemeasure and Dice

185846.name: Gates & Gorgons
185846.description:
From the dedication:

Inspirations : D&D, Barbarians of Lemuria, the Burning Wheel, Ryuu Tama and my very own Fantasy Heartbreaker Tranchons & Traquons.

User summary:

Characters have three Attributes (Brawn, Wits, and Soul) that have nine points divided among them. One Attribute must have a score of five and the other Attributes must have a score of at least one. Several races are detailed. Characters select a Path (Warrior, Thief, or Wizard) which determines Secondary Attributes. Characters also have one or more Past Careers which grant secondary skills. Resolution of actions uses multiple d12 rolls with a curious mechanic involving multiples of the same number being handled as a special case. This added complexity causes die rolls not to conform to a standard bell distribution.

185847.name: The Guild Adventurer (Issue 1 - Nov 2006)
185847.description:
The Guild Adventurer
Putting Adventures Back Into Roleplaying
Issue 1 - November 2006

The Vampire's Borrow
The Paranoia Game
The Flying Toadstool
Web of the Kobolds
The Red Hooded Traveler
The Temple of the Three

185848.name: The Guild Adventurer (Issue 2 - Sep 2007)
185848.description:
The Guild Adventurer
Putting Adventures Back Into Roleplaying
Issue 2 - September 2007

Hunting Season
The Echoes of History
Rose Petals and Snow Lions
Vorlori's Rest
The Selkie's Secret

185849.name: The Guild Adventurer (Issue 3 - Apr 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Money in Fantasy Role Playing Games
185849.description:
The Guild Adventurer
Putting Adventures Back Into Roleplaying
Issue 3 - April 2009

185850.description:
The Chest of Seth has found its way into the heartland kingdoms. Fortunately, king Morem has ordered the destruction of this evil relic. Your aim is to oversee Ezrok and his companions as they transport the chest far away from civilization. This task will take you through the Swamps of the Black Dragon, the Hills of Vorkin, and deep into an icy wasteland where the chest must be destroyed in the Eternal Chasm.

This game uses a tile laying system to move Ezrok and his companions across the different regions toward their goal. It is after this point that Ezrok can arrive at the Eternal Chasm to destroy the chest and begin the second challenge- the return trip.

This compilation includes the base game, a new deck, and favored expansion components to create the ultimate solitaire tile-laying adventure. The edition includes:


Tile Cards
Character Roster Cards
Quest Cards
Cosmic Boost Deck (new)
Wandering Threats Deck
Wild Cards Deck
Power Cards Deck
Enhanced Reference Material
Rulebook and Bonus Booklet
Printed Box


___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
185850.name: The Task of Ezrok: Deluxe Edition

185851.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 188 - Oct 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Games for Two: An In-Depth Look Part 1
Warhammer Quest: The Adventure Card Game
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
185851.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue 188 - October 2015

Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game
The Amazing Spider-Man for Marvel Dice Masters
Star Wars: The Force Awakens

185852.name: Pinboliada
185852.description:
The aim of the game is to form as many groups of the same color of three or more balls moving along a track before it reaches the end of the track. At the bottom of the screen there is a spoon-like icon which can be moved right and left and shoots balls. In order to shoot balls from the canon upwards, the player must position the cursor over the canon, and click on the mouse.

Source: The Game Website.

185853.name: Gehennum
185853.description:
From the introduction:

Gehennum is a volcanic and mountainous archipelago on a watery fantasy world. The islands are ringed with coral and clad in jungle, except where the people have cleared them to grow rice. The flora and fauna are generally like those of south-east Asia, though there are some introduced species (especially crops) and fantasy bring-ins.

The people of Gehennum are small, lithe, and brown-skinned. They have a sophisticated culture and technology, at least as advanced in every respect as the classical Mediterranean (Greeks and Romans), and in some areas (such as optics and chemistry) considerably better.

One important respect in which the Gehennese suffer by comparison with default fantasy cultures is that (there being no extensive grasslands on their world) there are no horses or equivalent riding animals. The very wealthy ride elephants, but on the whole heavily-armoured burgher infantry (not aristocratic cavalry) dominate Gehennese battlefields, politics, and society.

Another, less important, is that metals are relatively scarce. The Gehennese (and other peoples of the World of Isles) use glass, obsidian, bone, shell, and flint for cheap cutting edges. Where they use steel and bronze they use it with economy and the highest craftsmanship.

185854.name: Sudoku Jokers
185854.description:
A unique version of the popular game. Drag and position the balls exactly according to Sudoku rules. In order meet the designated time, you can use the jokers which can be placed instead of any of the numbers.

Source: The Game Website.

185855.name: Chock Chock
185855.description:
The classic computer game in which you have to form whole lines of bricks by moving groups of bricks left or right, or by rotating them. You can control the groups of bricks by means of the keyboard arrows; the upper arrow will rotate the group of bricks.

Source: The Game Website.

185856.name: Presents Panic
185856.description:
A christmas combination of several different puzzle games into one. It’s not just a tetris clone! Read the instructions!

Source: The Game Website.

185858.name: How Does Your Garden Grow
185858.description:
Step into CyberChris’ muddy shoes and become a virtual gardener. On your journey, your watering skills and gardening knowledge will be put to the ultimate test

Source: The Game Website.

185859.name: FruitFall
185859.description:
Fruit Fall is a ‘revolutionary’ new puzzle game that is guaranteed to keep you coming back for just one more try. Match up the fruit by turning the grid and allowing the fruit to fall. Fruit-tastic!

Source: The Game Website.

185860.name: You've Been Hacked
185860.description:
The game can be played in two different modes. The "Training Operation" mode is a free-for-all where players try to prove they are the most qualified hacker for the secret agent position. The "Special Operation" mode is a team mode (all vs. one) where one player takes on the role of a rogue agent trying to protect secret information. The other players try to recover all of the critical data before security shuts the whole system down.

In both modes gameplay proceeds in turns. During a player's turn he will move his pawn from one tile to another (which represents accessing different computer systems) across connection points, revealing facedown tiles in the process. Each revealed tile will indicate how many data tokens are to be placed on the tile facedown. A player on that tile can choose to take the data tokens which each indicate a value on their face which is kept hidden from the other players. Collected data tokens can be saved by a player by returning to his start tile. A player can also leave firewall and virus tokens on a tile which will slow other players down. In addition to finding data on revealed tiles, players can also find antivirus tokens and firewall access tokens which will allow them to move to a tile containing a virus or firewall. If two players' pawns are on the same tile one of them may initiate a hack attack, which involves rolling dice. The victor may steal a data token from the loser.

The game continues for 11-15 rounds after which the player who has saved the most data is the winner (in "Training Operation" mode).

In "Special Operation" mode the rogue agent must prevent the other agents from retrieving all of the data tokens before time runs out.

185861.name: Magneto
185861.description:
Addictive game in which you have to move the magnetic ball to the exit of each level using your arrow keys. Different magnets will attract or push you off, try not to bounce against them, walls or other obstacles.

Source: The Game Website.

185862.name: Alphabet Hunter
185862.description:
The alphabet is playing hard to get.

Click the letters of the alphabet in the correct order.

Rollover the blue powerups for bonus points, the green ones give extra time.

The best way to get far in the game is to think ahead and memorize the locations of the upcoming letters of the alphabet.

Source: The Game Website.

185863.name: World Of The Rings
185863.description:
3in1 Puzzle. Rotate and kill all.

Use mouse for controll. Rotating rings on a game field would collect more than two same figures in trenches that them to destroy. Thus clear a game field.

Source: The Game Website.

185864.name: Toss
185864.description:
Throw your Candy Corn around and fill up the ‘Bowl For Teh Candies’ in this 10 level mouse-interactive game. Includes a high score board to submit your scores at the end of the game!

Source: The Game Website.

185865.name: Uber Breakout II
185865.description:
It’s like breakout… except it’s round… and uber.

Use the left and right arrow keys to spin the paddles. Green powerups = good. Red powerups = bad.

Source: The Game Website.

185866.name: Shrink
185866.description:
Prevent your ball from shrinking into nothingness by hovering over the blue ball and avoiding the black balls. You may think its simple, but you are very, very, very wrong. Enjoy!

Mouse to move.

Source: The Game Website.

185867.name: Rings and Sticks
185867.description:
Grow your tree into the rings and around the dangers

Click the buttons or use 1 2 3 4 5 keys

Source: The Game Website.

185868.name: Water Dash!
185868.description:
Save the world by providing water to those in need. Water is a much bigger issue then people realize, and we need to educate ourselves and others on the problems we are having worldwide with water. This game is old, but the same issues still apply.

Arrows to move. Click the links afterwards to see how you can help.

Source: The Game Website.

185869.name: Get Out 2.0
185869.description:
Escape the room game with quirky graphics and pretty tricky puzzles.

Mouse to select different actions (bottom), then use them on the objects round the room.

Source: The Game Website.

185870.name: Squeezed!
185870.description:
Avoid the stars, survive as long as possible! A quick minigame if you have a few seconds to play a game.

Mouse to move, avoid everything :).

Source: The Game Website.

185871.name: The Getaway 3
185871.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




The Getaway 3 is the third instalment of Sony's The Getaway series for the PlayStation 3 console. The title was reported as cancelled on 4 June 2008.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Getaway (video game series)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

185872.name: Ball Revamped 2: Metaphysik
185872.description:
The Ball Revamped Game that got the ball rolling on the series. Navigate 100 levels of ball-wobbling action, while avoiding obstacles and walls. Can you make it to the boss?!? Of course you can, just set aside an hour and get going!

Up key to get started, other arrow keys to move around

Source: The Game Website.

185873.name: WarDevil: Unleash the Beast Within
185873.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Levels in such places as ruined wastelands, desert strongholds, ruined hotels, huge bars, and military bases. Digi-Guys also released info that they are working on 'an accompanying a Blu-Ray movie that is at least graphically equal to the game. It will be used to debut various characters and scenarios throughout the life of the main WarDevil Project, entitled WarDevil Chronicles.

185874.name: Generic Destinies
185874.description:
User summary:

Generic destines is in most respects a fairly straightforward generic, universal roleplaying system. It's major innovation involves a system of dice management to produce intrinsically limited percentile rolls for action resolution. Actions are rolled against a target difficult noted as a percentage. Instead of using traditional d100s, however, the system replaces one or both of the 2d10 with other dice. For example, an unskilled character may roll 1d4/1d10 to generate a "percentile" roll of 01-49 whereas a highly skilled character might roll d12/d10 for the same task.

Characters have five Stats (Attributes): Combat, Body, Awareness, Intellect, and Technique. Stats have values between 4 and 12 in a discontinuous range (4, 6, 8, 10, 12). The Stats value determines which type of die is used for "percentile" rolls. Characters likewise have Skills, which are player-defined. Skill Levels range from 4-10 also in a discontinuous range (4, 6, 8, 10), and also aligned with the type of dice used.

185875.name: A Fistful of Destinies
185875.description:
User summary:

A Fistful of Destinies provides a card-based mechanism that replaces the innovative "percentile" system used in Generic Destinies. A Fistful of Destinies is not a complete game by itself. The method works by having each player hold a hand of cards from a standard deck of playing cards. Players then "bid" by playing cards to generate a result. The first card holds the "tens" place and any other cards are summed for the "ones" place (which may carry to the "tens"). Hands often are suit-restricted (limiting play) based on the Stat or Skill target level. Face cards, Aces, and Jokers all are "special case" cards.

185876.name: Red Lead
185876.description:
In support of Red Nose Day 2007 we proudly present ‘Red Lead’. Help save the Red Noses by getting them safely from one side of the screen to the other, avoiding the sharp pencils.

Source: The Game Website.

185877.name: Radius (2007)
185877.description:
Smash circles together in a mass of colours and particles! Work up a highscore and compete against others.

Source: The Game Website.

185878.name: Rolley-Ball
185878.description:
Roll a ball around in an effort to escape from various levels. (Try not to explode into a gory mess in the process.)

Source: The Game Website.

185879.name: The Karnak Maze 2
185879.description:
Enjoy your secound adventure into the karnak maze amazingly improved graphics and game, however this tomb is more deadly than before this game will show you hard and easy levels take care. Also remember to check out the buttons before playing i cannot insure your safety if not. Enjoy it.

Source: The Game Website.

185880.name: Snake (2007)
185880.description:
Ok it’s redone i took out the annoying background and made it a speed that everyone can handle.

Arrows to Move. Click to Start

Source: The Game Website.

185881.name: -Bounce-
185881.description:
Try and keep the ball bouncing by drawing lines with the mouse.

Source: The Game Website.

185882.name: Ivan's beta game 5000
185882.description:
Lead the stick figure all across the maze without touching anything, but the end box.

Use mouse to take figure across.

Source: The Game Website.

185883.name: Exorbis
185883.description:
Slide the balls around to match them up to the coloured targets! Increasingly difficult puzzle game with online high-scores.

Click on the blue sliders to move the coloured balls around. All balls must be on appropriate nodes to complete the level. You may skip the level if you are over par. You get more points for completing the level faster and in fewer moves, so hurry! More difficulty levels will be unlocked when you have enough points.

Source: The Game Website.

185884.name: Cursor Mayhem
185884.description:
This game re-invented the term ‘hard’. This game will have you wiggling your mouse furiously as you try to get to the end of each level.

Use your mouse to move the cursor, you can of course cheat, but where’s the fun in that?

Source: The Game Website.

185885.name: Trapdoors & Treasure!
185885.description:
It’s a raid! Guide the pirate captain and his crew down the ladders to the treasure as fast as you can, but watch out for those swinging skeletons and the rolling cannonballs!

Just click to open the trapdoors and lift the hanging skeletons

Source: The Game Website.

185886.name: Parking Perfection 2
185886.description:
Five brand new levels in this long awaited sequel to Mousebreaker’s Parking Perfection game, this time including ice patches and darkness. Park it perfectly!

Use the arrow keys to steer, and the space bar to brake hard

Source: The Game Website.

185887.name: Art Thief
185887.description:
By day you are a corporate raider, by night you are the most feared art thief in the world, the ‘Specter”. Your new weapon— a highly advanced electronic alarm-sniffer that you use to steal priceless works of art and sell them on the black market.

Type in the code to break the alarm. Use the indicator to see if you are high or low.

Source: The Game Website.

185888.name: Lindt Gold Bunny Hunt
185888.description:
Fun game for upcoming Easter. The Lindt & Sprüngli’s iconic Gold Bunny is on the loose! Search several U.S. cities to find the Gold Bunny and unlock trivia questions about chocolate and the cities you visit.

Find the gold bunny and answer the trivia questions. It is that simple.

Source: The Game Website.

185889.name: Flour Child
185889.description:
It’s up to the Flour Child to dispose of the corrupted dough!

Move around Flour Child with your mouse and try and keep the dough off of you.

Source: The Game Website.

185890.name: Boomshine
185890.description:
A colorful, relaxing game by K2xL with beautiful music by Tim Halbert. Dots appear and explode causing a chain reaction.

Simply click the mouse to trigger an explosion; any dots that come into contact with the resulting circle will also explode.

Source: The Game Website.

185891.name: Sun Blocks
185891.description:
Sun-inspired fun falling block game.

Arrow keys to position blocks. Space bar to rotate the blocks.

Source: The Game Website.

185892.name: Blobuloids
185892.description:
Feed the blobs their cheeseburgers first, then their cakes, and finally their beers as fast as you can!

Simple controls using the mouse.

Source: The Game Website.

185893.name: KHR0ME 2: Silver
185893.description:
This is the sequel to Khrome 1, around level 10 or 11 they turn invisible so watch out!

Drag the ball back and release it, dodge the circles that are colored.

Source: The Game Website.

185894.name: Munni Matkewali
185894.description:
Try your luck at 3 Cup Monty. Indian Style!!!

Use your mouse to play the game. Select the amount you want to bid and click on Bet to begin. You cannot bet less than 100 or more than 500. If you have less than 100 in cash then it’s Game Over.

Source: The Game Website.

185895.name: Slingette
185895.description:
Guess who’s got a little sister? That’s right, meet the newest member of the Sling family – Slingette. Sling, flick and snap her through 20 levels of puzzling action fun!

Click on Slingette with your mouse, pull back and release to flick.

Source: The Game Website.

185896.name: Metal Gear Online
185896.description:
It is an online multiplayer spin-off of the Metal Gear video game series. Τhe Starter Pack of Online was available worldwide bundled with Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots, with a standalone release for Japan. Metal Gear Online‍ '​s North American and European servers were shut down on June 12, 2012.

On June 13, 2013, Hideo Kojima officially confirmed that Metal Gear Online will be included with Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain.

Source: Wikipedia, "Metal Gear Online", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

185898.name: Dobble
185898.description:
In this game you collect letters to form the word given to you at the start of a level. Can you get through all worlds?

Arrows to move, start with first letter then follow the word.

Source: The Game Website.

185899.name: Quadrato
185899.description:
Circle around the white squares then collect them when they turn red!

just use your Mouse!

Source: The Game Website.

185900.name: Capsules
185900.description:
I was not satisfied with the look of the previous game. This one is less flashy, more user friendly, and offers 138 levels! The level designers are doing an amazing job on Pepere. A magic incantation can unlock the levels.

Grab the blue capsules and avoid the red ones.

Source: The Game Website.

185901.name: Squares Escape
185901.description:
Move your mouse around to avoid the blue circles and collect the Red crosses.

Source: The Game Website.

185902.name: Numbers Fantastic!
185902.description:
Use your arrow keys to match your circle with incoming floating numbers! Keep trying to beat your score, it gets very tricky towards the end!

Source: The Game Website.

185903.name: Shifty Puzzle
185903.description:
move the pieces of the puzzle back into their correct order and then see if you can do it again and beat your high score!

Source: The Game Website.

185904.name: LePussé in Paris
185904.description:
Monsters have invaded Paris! It is up to you LePussé to destroy them and bring peace to Paris once again!

Instructions are within the game

Source: The Game Website.

185905.name: Psychopath
185905.description:
Use the arrow keys to move your spinning block to the ending block.
For the level editor, check the level editor help button on the top right.

Source: The Game Website.

185907.name: Baby Frog the board game
185907.description:
User Summary

Basic version of "Frogger".

Source: The Game Website.

185908.name: Snake Maze
185908.description:
User Summary

My first game. Simple game of following the path without touching the sides.

185909.name: Reverse
185909.description:
Use your mouse to navigate various hazrad filled levels – all with your movements reversed!

Source: The Game Website.

185910.name: Rocket Car
185910.description:
Rocket Car is an extremely addicting platform-puzzle game that takes you through 30 engaging levels! This free game features simple but creatively designed levels with moving platforms, strategically placed items, challenging obstacles and more! If you’re a fan of cars and rockets, this game is definitely for you!

Source: The Game Website.

185911.name: Pathways (Issue 52 - Sep 2015)
rpgissuearticle: 20 Things to Find in a Rat Infested Dungeon
185911.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Poisonous Pathways

How can you say to no to even more FREE Pathfinder content. A monster template, poisons, purgatives, liniments, and cure-alls; Vermin infested Dungeon Dressings and treasure chests, plus the Isle of Tranquiliy, as well as episode #17 of the Path Less Traveled Comic by Jacob Blackmon. If you say no, we will release a walking wasteland blink dog into your campaign!

Rite Publishing brings you Pathways, a free 'zine packed with plenty of Open Gaming Content you can bring to nearly any table. You'll find articles by Rpg Superstar Mike Welham (Pathfinder Module: Doom Comes to Dustpawn), Jonathan McAnulty(Curse of the Golden Spear Adventure Trilogy), Steven D. Russell (Book of Monster Templates) and Creighton Broadhurst (Raging Swan Press) plus an interview with super-powered legend, artist, and cartoonist Jacob Blackmon.

185912.name: Stubbs Mouse Avoider
185912.description:
Created by Kevin Stubbs “Woad”.
A 5 level mouse avoider. Try to reach the finish, avoid all obstacles at all costs! If you’ve got any level ideas say em and ill add em, i’ll give level idea credit to you.

lick the Start button to start. Avoid obsctales with the mouse and get to finish without hitting anything. On the level Confusion use arrow keys, reversing may occur…

Source: The Game Website.

185913.name: Ultimate Riddle
185913.description:
Mouse and keyboard to answer riddles.

Source: The Game Website.

185914.name: Push, Pull, and Burn
185914.description:
A simple, fast paced game. Try to burn your opponent with a floating crystal.

Source: The Game Website.

185915.name: Ultimate Riddle 2
185915.description:
A new set of riddles. Improved difficult!

Source: The Game Website.

185916.name: Heroes 1: Hiro
185916.description:
Point and Click Adventure Mystery

Source: The Game Website.

185917.name: Missing Link
185917.description:
Kerry’s team thinks they have found the Missing Link. One likes pinto beans and bar-b-q, the other digs bananas and flinging poo! Yet, they both seem to share some startling similarities. Is their theory right or is this just more hype from the very far left?

Source: The Game Website.

185918.name: Snowboarder line drawer
185918.description:
You draw the line to get into the elavator, which then rises to the next level. The goal is to reach heaven

Source: The Game Website.

185919.name: Rings
185919.description:
Clever puzzle game involving stacking rings. The pressure mounts as the levels progress.

Use the space to release the centrepiece ahead of time or click on it. Pick up and move pieces with your mouse.

Source: The Game Website.

185920.name: Disco Sudoku
185920.description:
Sudoku with a disco theme

Source: The Game Website.

185921.name: Sky Bouncer
185921.description:
You bounce the ball into the elevater, dont hit the spikes

Source: The Game Website.

185922.description: Orleans: Neue Ortskarten N°3 ("Place Tiles N°3") is a mini expansion for Orléans that consists of three new place tiles: Port, Quarry, and Workshop (Hafen, Steinbruch, und Werkstatt).
185922.name: Orléans: Neue Ortskarten N°3

185923.description:
A small expansion for Peloponnes, where every player starts with an extra token. This token is worth points at the end of the game, or can be used once during the game to acquire a tile that would otherwise be discarded.

This DIY kit was handed out at Essen Spiel 2015. The bagged kit consists of a German/English/French rules sheet and dual-sided printed card that contains the 8 Victoria Chits that must be cut out by the owner.
185923.name: Peloponnes: Victoria Expansion

185924.name: Indukto
185924.description: Each player owns six pieces of heights 1, 2 or 3. The objective of the game is to move the pieces thus the pieces of same height are in orthogonal adjacency. A single piece may move exactly as many steps in any direction as it is high. As soon as a piece is adjacent to an other piece it loses its own movement but may only move as far as one of the neighbours induces by its height.

185925.name: Echoes of Salvation Quick Design Player Intro
185925.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is a small printable booklet designed to help Game Keepers introduce new players to the game. The idea is to print and present this booklet to any prospective new player before the gaming session. The player then returns the fully filled in form included in the back of the booklet to the GK. The GK is then able to save time and confusion by designing a character for the new player based on their personal choices presented on the form. This allows the GK to present a pre-generated character for a first time player while still allowing the player some good input into their pre-gen character.

NOTE: This product does not contain rules or gameplay material. In order to be utilized correctly, this product requires the Echoes of SalvationTM - Core Rules and the Echoes of SalvationTM - Prayer Book, which are both supplied seperately.

185927.name: Mystical Guardians
185927.description:
From publisher blurb:

When evil hides in the shadows and corrupts the souls of innocents, when it attacks the mind more than the body, when the threat is too insidious for normal adventurers, it is time for Mystical Guardians. The Planar Blooded have gathered to fight against dangers that normal adventurers are unable to oppose. From a sylph who has only been in these realms for a few years to an oread who fought these same evils millenia ago, these Mystical Guardians are ready to use their unusual abilities in your campaign.

185928.name: The Robotic Age: Mars
185928.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Welcome, new settlers of Mars! As your colony ship enters it's final approch to the red planet please take note of the following safetly tips:

Only 25% of Mars is terraformed, with all hostile areas being hostile to human life.
Mecha are a new, unregulated technology so be aware of student pilots.
All rumors of genetically modifed mutants roaming the wastelands are, of course, false.
Always trust The Face On Mars for your news source."




The Robotic Age: Mars suppliment adds a ton of new features for your Robotic Age game, including

A new designation: The Genetically Modified Human
New Rules including Cover and Radiation
Four new Fighting Styles
Over 40 new Upgrades
Mecha and Vehicle rules




Take your explosive robot action to the next level, or even the next planet, with The Robotic Age: Mars.

185929.name: Chemist
185929.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unleash the chemist upon your foes (or upon your players). The chemist is adept at using alchemical weapons and sheathing his other weapons in alchemical concoctions to smite his foes with different energies. They can improve their battle prowess with their extracts and even gain resistances to different energy types and poisons.

Having access to a select number of extracts and discoveries, chemists are versatile in how they confront their enemies and resolve any conflict.

185930.name: The Children of Despair
185930.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Red Maple Grove. Grab a pumpkin ale and stay for a while.

Apart from the infamously strange bookshop, the ramblings of an unhinged old man, a reclusive lord who rarely leaves his manor house and a history of the dark arts being practised in the surrounding woods, Red Maple Grove is just like any other farming village in the realm. Well, until now...

Welcome to Red Maple Grove.
The harvest has begun.
A sleepy farming village is ravaged with a curse that leaves its youths fighting to survive through the night.
Discover the truth behind unexplained and horrific events in this chilling introductory adventure for level 2 characters.

185931.name: Reliquary
185931.description:
From publisher blurb:

RELIQUARY!
Traveling through time and space to collect the mystic artifacts of thousands of worlds, Reliquary is stuck in your campaign world and ready to take on your heroes! Armed with several relics and mystical devices, can they stop him from pilfering your world's artifacts? Or will they fall like the others?

185932.name: SciFi Research Lab
185932.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a full-color, 32 inch by 30 inch, floor plan of a SciFi Crew Quarters, with Hex, Square and No overlay.

The Zip File includes the VTT (Virtual Table Top Images for online play) and a 360 degree view of the room.

“If this experiment works we should be able to view a lifeform from another world for study without any dangers to our scientists and students.”—Research Biophysicist

SciFi Research Lab is a large interior map of a one floor futuristic research lab suitable for military, corporate, or educational purposes (i.e. a military or corporate research & development lab or a high tech university laboratory). This product includes a 360-degree panoramic view from the north side of the center of the lab.

SciFi Research Lab is intended for use in near or far-future science fiction. This could also be a secret high tech facility in a modern game.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Intensive Study: Biophysicists at a research & development lab have developed something they call the Tinted Window. This technology allows them to witness other worlds and dimensions for study without leaving the safety of the lab. This window views the subject and allows for observations to be made about the alien flora or fauna being studied without the subject being aware of being observed.

Initial tests were made with life indigenous to the planet. This kind of data could be obtained with a time delay via satellites. However the device could be used to observe the same information except in real time.

Studying alien worlds followed with similar positive results as the scientists studied planets throughout the galaxy. One effect that was seen was that the view became increasingly hazy the more light years away the targeted planet was from their world. Like viewing from a real world window, the farther the subject was in distance, the harder it became to discern details.

Now the biophysicists have set their sights on viewing another dimension. The initial tests have seen strange results compared to the other tests. The view seen is nearly opaque with the only movement seen as grey clouds moving in almost utter darkness. The scientists theorize this may be due to distance between dimensions being greater than anything in our universe. But something has been observing the scientists back. The next time the scientists open the window to look at the dimension, a thick grey mist diffuses through a gateway and starts killing the scientists by asphyxiating them. Security protocols are triggered and the group as military or corporate security is sent inside to deal with this bizarre gaseous monster from another realm.

Alternatively, the entire building is soon filled with gas as the grey mist diffuses throughout and then starts pouring out into the surrounding town through gaps in doorways or open windows. The group may be inside the town as this mist roils through and suffocates those who try to breathe inside the mist. The group needs to escape or find a way to survive traversing through the mist to stop it at its source.

185933.name: Tossers
185933.description:
From the Introduction:

Tossers is a fantasy RPG. What makes it different? You not only roll your dice, but you roll them on a mat that gives bonuses for where they drop, and can knock a opponents dice away from where they land when you drop, toss, or roll them down. Maybe even knock them out of play entirely.

185934.name: England is Dead
185934.description:
From the Introduction:

England is Dead is a roleplaying game set in an alternate England of the late 17th Century. In this setting the bubonic plague wiped out 95% of the population, leaving isolated pockets of civilisation scattered around the country. The players will travel the desolate land, discovering what humanity remains, and ensuring it is of the standard that England expects.

Think of the setting as a dark English 17th Century post-apocalypse. The group should decide on a tone before they play. England is Dead can be played as a grim look at a fallen society, a perilous adventure, or a story of dark horror.

To play you need a Games Master (GM), some players, pencils & paper and a few D6 per player.

boardgamecompilation: World of Tanks: Rush – Deluxe Edition
185935.description:
Last Stand is the second expansion for the popular card game World of Tanks: Rush, based on the online-hit World of Tanks.

Tank battles take a new turn — Last Stand adds Japanese vehicles, new achievements and special rules, special universal tanks, destruction cards to weaken the decks, and much more.

Adapt to new standards of war to defeat your opponents!

Russian description:
«Последний бой» — второе дополнение к популярной настольной карточной
игре World of Tanks: Rush, разработанной по мотивам онлайн-хита World
of Tanks.

Танковые сражения принимают новый оборот — «Последний бой» добавляет в игру бронетехнику Японии, новые достижения и варианты правил, особенные универсальные танки, карты разрушений, которые ослабляют колоды, и многое другое.

Адаптируйтесь к новым стандартам ведения войны, чтобы одержать победу над соперниками!
185935.name: World of Tanks: Rush 3 - Last Stand

185936.name: Tragedy and Triumph
185936.description:
From the Introduction:

Herakles. Beowulf. Cúchlainn. Arjuna. Thor. Aladdin. King Arthur. Gilgamesh. Jesus. Sun Wukong. Ilmarinen.

Names that echo through myth and history, heroes that have inspired generations, subjects of poems, music, literature, plays, whose great deeds are forever remembered. They live forever in the stories people have told each other from generation to generation, enchanting children and adults alike..

This is not who you are.

You are the ones who were discarded, the ones who have no songs or stories, the ones who slipped out of humanity's collective memory. You don't even get to be the great villains or beasts the heroes defeat, or the mentors or lesser characters who help them on their way to greatness. You were left behind.

Left behind in the Silence, the Forgotten Land, the Unremembrance. Your home has many names, none of them important because who would speak of it save you who are already there, and what need have you to speak of a place you cannot leave?

There is little to speak of even should you want to. The sky is eternally overcast, no sun or moon or stars to divide the eternal gloom into days and nights. Most of it is wrapped in the thick fog that rises from the oily sea and shadowy bogs, and the few crumbling mountain peaks that rise above it are swept by a keening wind that cuts through cloth and thoughts alike. Everything is murky, grey, and rotting.

Everything apart from the Pit. In a place of gloomy half-light it is the only perfect darkness, a spiral of worn, water-slick stairs going down into the black depths. It's the only permanent landmark here, where everything else shifts and slides when nobody looks, where the landscape forgets its own form from one minute to the next.

It's where everyone goes when they can no longer stand the grey, when the cutting winds around the peaks is no longer enough to empty their minds of sadness. Down they go, some slipping on the treacherous steps to fall silently into the darkness, some disappearing into the shadows still on their feet. Many go alone, but sometimes one leaving will pull others with them, like a flock of birds flying south as winter comes, together circling the echoing darkness until they are all lost from sight.

Now your time has come. You have lost the will to stay among the weak and tired, your own weaknesses and exhaustion carrying you here, to the edge of the Pit. Perhaps you look around in a last farewell to a place you can no longer stand, perhaps you take that first step without looking back. Soon enough it is all the same; soon enough all memories of the Grey Land fades and all you can see is the cracked, damp stone of the next step before you, each one deeper in shadow than the last. Maybe someone is following you, or maybe you are following them. It no longer matters.

You are all alone.

185937.name: Two Hunters
185937.description:
From the Introduction:

Two Hunters is a demon hunting RPG for two players and no GM. Players take turns describing challenges based upon dice rolls, and then make rolls to overcome them. For the purpose of this game, the older player is PLAYER ONE and the younger player is PLAYER TWO.

The Story

Your characters belong to a holy order of demon hunters known as Sacred Jaegers. About a hundred years ago, the Yuvikamf Empire discovered ancient cities built by unknown civilizations and colonized them. One of the Empire's most fantastical settlements is proving a hotbed for demonic activity, and you and your partner have been sent to investigate.

185938.name: Springers
185938.description:
From the Introduction:

In Springers each player will take on the role of a disembodied mind jumping randomly through an infinity of possible universes. Each time you play your disembodied mind will find itself temporarily possessing the body of someone who normally lives in that universe. You work to solve their problems and then your mind leaves their bodies, hopefully with them better off than before, and travels on to the next universe.

We've all seen Quantum Leap right? It's like that.

185939.name: The Journey
185939.description:
The Journey is a game for two players.

The Ghost and The Pilgrim appear in Limbo.
Both of them are somehow related.

The rest, you'll have to play to find out.

185941.name: Cirque Noir
185941.description:
A spectacularly mysterious murder mystery in a literal and figurative underground circus

From the Introduction:

Cirque Noir is a narrative game about circus performers solving a crime in their enclosed circus arena.

Each player takes control of a circus performer of the name-sake Cirque Noir, an underground circus in your country after it has been normalized. The performers are some of the few people left that are unregistered and do not follow the grey-samish lifestyle of the norms. Each performer has a few Feats, an Acquaintance, a Grudge and their own Drive for being in the Cirque.

During the last show, someone was murdered. At least for one player-controlled character, there is no way that this was an accident. They lock down the facility and no-one may leave. There are a few primes present and a whole crowd of grey, nameless norms. They cannot call the Normalizers, of course, so the performers have to investigate the murder themselves.

During the course of the investigation, performers will find clues to what happened and why and whodunnit. There will also be action sequences and of course questioning of suspects. Possibly, there will also be quarrels between the performers.

In this game, there is no game master or similar facilitator. Instead, the actions of the players will determine which of the suspects is the murderer. The game resolves when the murderer is found and either is held accountable for their crime(s) or makes their escape.

You will (probably) need at least three players, as many sheets of paper, a pen and a stack of index cards to play this game properly.

185942.name: Goosebumps: The Game
185942.description:
User Summary

The game is intended as a prequel to the 2015 Goosebumps movie.

185944.name: Tricky Treats! (24-hour RPG)
185944.description:
From the Introduction:

It's finally here, Halloween! Trick or Treating! Candy! You and your friends have been waiting all year for this glorious evening and now it has arrived! And, this year it's going to be special. This year you're heading to Golden Oaks, the ritzy neighborhood where the real treats await! No more rock hard Mary Janes or stale candy corn for you! Those bronze door knockers in Golden Oaks will bring you a real haul. King sized candy bars, giant battery operated lollipops, silver dollars, and more! All that remains now is to don your costume and meet your friends on the road to the sugary paradise of Golden Oaks.

Only, there's a couple small snags. All the big kids are out tonight too, and they'd rather steal candy than get it on their own. Then there's getting to Golden Oaks.

Sure, you could follow Drewry Lane out past the high school and enter Golden Oaks from the east side, but that would take hours of walking and you don't have hours to waste with so many houses to hit, so many treats to claim. That means taking a shortcut. That means going through Old Man Fedwicks Farm. People, kids mostly, say the old man is off his rocker. There's all kinds of stories about what he's done to kids who got caught on his property. That isn't going to stop you though. You've got your friends and there's safety in numbers. Right?

185945.name: Math Dice Chase
185945.description: One part hot potato, one part math — Math Dice Chase tests your ability to quickly do mental math. Game players must sit in a circle. Two players each roll a pair of dice, then multiply the two numbers shown on the dice. Hurry to roll the dice, call out your answer, and pass the dice before you get caught with a second pair in front of you! Once you get caught with two pairs of dice, you are eliminated. The final two players enter a modified round of play, and the person who can multiply the quickest wins.

185946.name: Once We Were Heroes: The Summer Children
185946.description:
From the Introduction:

Once We Were Heroes: The Summer Children is an RPG for a GM and up to 5 players. It's set in a world of faeries and boglins, and borrows heavily from European folklore, Celtic fairy tales in particular.

The players have memories of a previous life, when they were brave heroes who stopped a war between man and faerie, and then vanished. Now that there are signs of a new invasion, they are called upon to be heroes in this life. During their travels to the Otherworld, the realm of the fae, they will remember more and more of their previous heroic life, and grow more powerful. Or they might die.

Death is not the end, however. In the Otherworld, the players' spirits have no problem finding a new body, similar to the old one. But dying is not without a cost. The more the players reincarnate, the more they lose their humanity and the more fae-like they become. When they reach the faerie court, will they remember enough of their human past to save their kin?

Once We Were Heroes: The Summer Children gives an outline for a story, but you'll never play the same game twice. It uses only a few d6, and you won't ever have to sum dice or modifiers; you can see the result of a die roll at a glance. Shared narrative control is built into the game. Combat is fast, simple and deadly. Players have the tools and abilities to overcome challenges in many different ways (without fear of failure or death) and the GM doesn't have to pull punches.

185947.name: MASTER PLAN
185947.description:
From the Introduction:

MASTER PLAN is an RPG designed for solo play in which you play the role of a villain devising their strategy for achieving their ultimate goal, whatever that may be.

185948.name: Stratos Spheres
185948.description: Stratos Spheres is a the classic four-in-a-row game without the restrictions of the 2D board. In fact, there's no board at all because you build the game as you go. Using three-dimensional spheres, each player tries to connect four of their spheres in a row while stopping their competitor from doing the same. The first to connect four spheres horizontally, vertically, or diagonally wins.

185949.name: Stranded
185949.description:
From the Synopsis:

You are survivor of a plane crash / ship wreck*.

This leaves you stranded in a virgin forest / deserted island*.

Another 2d3 people survives the disaster with you.

You are now stranded, with what you and the other survivors have preliminarily determined that there is no escape from the situation.

185950.name: Dead Phoenix
185950.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




Players would take control of a winged man as he flies around shooting massive enemies, with the aid of allies on foot. Capcom's announcement described the setting as a mythical floating city, full of monsters and dragons. It was canceled in August 2003 after failing to appear at E3.

Source: Wikipedia, "Capcom Five", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

185951.name: Cryptark
videogamehonor: 2015 CVA Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Global Game Awards Best Early Access Game of the Year Nominee
185951.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Cryptark is a 2D sci-fi rougelike shooter where you take on the role of a heavily armed privateer seeking to earn government contracts by boarding deadly alien space-hulks.

Source: [www.Cryptark.com The Game Website].

185952.name: Expedition zum Mond
185952.description: The players move from earth to the moon and back. The first player back on earth wins the game. Movement is determined by 3 dice. The player may chose the result of one of the 3 dice to move his piece. After each players turn, the turntable is rotated one step, changing the available flight paths. The players may block each others flight manoevres by placing stop-counters on the flight control panel of their opponents.

185953.name: Ghosts: The Incorporeal Undead
185953.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ghosts – The Incorporeal Undead includes everything needed to develop and use ghosts in your Labyrinth Lord campaign.

Deadly Details on Fear Attacks and Life Draining Touch!

Eerie Information on the Incorporeal powers of ghosts and other Undead Special Abilities!

Full disclosure on the Sinister Sixth Sense, Scary Sensitives, and Mysterious Mediums!

Ten different base ghostly types, covering each hit die from 1 to 10 hit dice, with countless thousands of combinations of 75 different ghostly special abilities!

Secrets of the uses and dangers of Uncanny Ectoplasm!

An expose of Eerie Enchanted Items!

Scads of rulings on Spooky Spells, new and old!

And a (relatively complete) Creepy Appendix N!

What more can you ask for?

185954.name: Divine Elven Spellsword
185954.description:
From publisher blurb:

Learn the divine ways of the first elves!

The Divine Elven Spellsword is a variant elven class for Adventurer Conqueror King and Labyrinth Lord, however you can play these divine elves in just about any OSR game. This class bring a new breed of elf to the game, one who wields divine magic instead of arcane power. Like their traditional elven counterparts, they are also fierce warriors who can stand face to face against the horrors of the darkness.

Also includes a new spell!

185955.name: Divine Elven Nightblade
185955.description:
From publisher blurb:

Learn the divine ways of the first elves!

The Divine Elven Nightblade is a variant elven class for Adventurer Conqueror King and Labyrinth Lord, however you can play these divine elves in just about any OSR game. This class bring a new breed of elf to the game, one who wields divine magic instead of arcane power. Like their traditional elven counterparts, they are also sly rogues and assassins who mix divine power to cloak their actions.

Also includes three new spell!

185956.name: Elven Wardancer
185956.description:
From publisher blurb:

Learn the divine ways of the first elves!

The Elven Warden is a new elven class for Adventurer Conqueror King and Labyrinth Lord, however you can play these divine elves in just about any OSR game. This class bring a new breed of elf to the game, one who wields divine magic instead of arcane power.

Wardancers are both the lore keepers and protectors of their woodelven kin. They stalk the enemies of their people and recount the tales and stories of their kind's ancient deeds. When they fight, it is as a whirlwind amongst their foes. They learn to blend with nature and wage war with deadly alacrity before disappearing back into the wilds from which they came.

Also includes one new spell!

185957.name: Canada Quest
185957.description:
A traditional style quiz game that features a Canadian theme and optional added elements of risk and wagering.

In the 'basic' game, players earn points by either answering the trivia questions posed by their opponents, or by their own questions being incorrectly answered twice.

In the advanced version, players are allowed to wager on whether opponents will correctly or incorrectly answer the question being asked.

A 3rd 'classroom' variation allows for group play by eliminating all advanced elements and simply posing questions to each team, with incorrect answers allowing the other team to 'steal' the point.

Play continues over as many ~5 minute rounds as players pre-determine, with the player or team with the most points being the victor.

Interestingly, this game was self-published sometime between 1980-1984 (based on question content) and includes no copyright date, publisher, or author information, other than a post-office box in Ottawa. A unique piece of Canadiana.

From the box: A quiz game exclusively for Canadians.
Thousands of Questions. Over 100 Categories.

Encompassing an "all-Canadian" theme, the questions cover a wide variety of topics. From PRIME MINISTERS to LAKES, from HOCKEY to EARLY DAYS, from INVENTIONS to MOVIES, there are 101 topics touching on all aspects of Canadian life. The questions are presented at three levels of difficulty with a corresponding point system. Players will find some questions easy, some "memory-testers", others educational.

Other Features of CANADA QUEST include:
-three variations
-second chance on each question
-time control
-wagering
-classroom use.

For 3-6 players / teams, Ages 12-adult. English.

185958.name: Genre
185958.description:
User summary:

Genre was intended to be a generic, universal system but the rules as developed were never clearly separated from the super-hero contents. Ostensibly, the rules also supported a swords & wizardry setting but this was never fully developed.

Characters are built with a pool of Character Points which has a base and a random component (e.g., 16 + 1d6). Attributes are purchased from the point pool with levels put into Strength, Agility, Stamina, Psi, Intelligence, and Psyche to purchase a noted Power Factor. Characters also have Skills and Talents. Skills have Modifiers (0-5). Characters may also have Extras (special abilities), Disads (disadvantages), and Powers (supernatural abilities). Characters have a Hit To Kill value which also is purchased. Through the game, Characters gain Experience Points which yield Levels and Glory Points which allow post-roll dice manipulation.

Genre uses a single mechanism for resolving all actions outside of combat, called an Action Roll. Characters roll a dice pool of d6 and count successes against a modified Difficulty. Optionally, Characters can "Grunt" or "Bust a Nut" and get a bonus which is offset by a later penalty. Four levels of success (Success to Critical Success) and five levels of failure (Failure to Critical Failure) are supported.

Combat uses a separate resolution mechanism that supports initiative, melee, ranged combat, blocking, dodging, and structural damage options. Armor boosts defensive rolls. Combat yields damage, of course, but may result in other effects. Much of combat involves the use of a number of "Power Factor" tables that range from 0-10 in stages.

185959.name: Cyclopean Deeps Volume II (Pathfinder)
185959.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Under Realms below the Lost Lands!

Volume 2 of the epic “sandbox” region started in Cyclopean Deeps Volume 1. This series of adventures, by ENnie Award-winning author Matt Finch, continues and completes the Cyclopean Deeps mini-campaign set in the deep and deadly Under Realms below Rappan Athuk.

185960.description:
The Classic Video Arcade Owners Game.

The classic video arcade in the golden age of gaming! Experience the lights, sounds & fun of the greatest arcade games on show and own them all! With players playing, buying & repairing cabinets the action heats up fast! Look out for power cuts, free plays, breakdowns and remember to empty your cabinets of all those shiny coins!

Overview:
Arcade-opoly is a 1(solo) to 4 player game where players dash around a classic video game arcade.

The object of the game is to buy and setup arcade games and begin to earn quarters from them. Your opponents will have to insert coins to play your arcade games should they stop in front them. Popular games will earn you double but don’t let your games break as “Out Of Order” games will earn you nothing.

Players move around the arcade clockwise by first throwing both a black and a white die. You may only move with either dice, choose wisely which of the dice to move with!

Gameplay cards collected by landing on the Gameplay spaces can help or hinder you. Some cards will offer free games, free plays or free repairs. Other cards though will trigger power cuts, force you to play an opponents game, move with only with one die or even send you back to Level 1.

To win the game you must be the first to collect enough coins from your arcade games coin box and reach the target money amount of 70 quarters. Be careful not to play or buy too many games because other costs may arise such as repair bills, loose change, power cuts and game crashes. Should a player lose all their startup money of 30 quarters the game ends. All the remaining players can then total up any coins left in their games with the highest being declared the winner.

Unique features:
Classic video game arcade theme.
2 dice choice mechanic
Money track scoring
16 colour wooden arcade cabinets
50 plastic coin Quarters to play & collect from the machines
36 gameplay cards
Power cuts, Free Plays, Free Repair and “Out Of Order” events
“Top Games” that earn double their price.
45 minute playtime.
3 lives per player for extended play.
Solo play variant as you compete against three CPU players.
185960.name: Arcade-opoly

185961.name: Ghost Light (Version 1.2)
185961.description:
User summary:

Ghost Light is a unique game that focuses on Ghosts existing in an afterlife. Players generate a Ghost (Character) with various attributes. The game does not presuppose any religious background to the afterlife, but instead presents a unique setting. Ghosts have an Age, but this reflects the number of previous lives they have had, from 1 to more than 50. A Ghost's power is based upon their Age so players should share Ghosts of similar Age. Age yields "Emotion Points" which are used to purchase ranks in various Emotions. The Emotion Rank determines how many dice are in a success roll pool. Some Ghosts have Skills, Quirks, Merits, and Flaws which are primarily narrative tags. Ghosts attempt to effect the material world by using raw emotion and stimuli. The system uses a standard unopposed roll versus Difficulty or an opposed roll against roll. Ghosts can gain in experience and power.

Note "Ghost Light" was used for the initial version (this version), but "Ghostlight" was used for subsequent versions.

185962.name: Ghostlight (Version 2)
185962.description:
User summary:

The basic action resolution roll involves using 2d6 plus modifiers compared to a Difficulty Value (-5 to 15). For opposed actions (including Combat), the Difficulty Value will be the opponents modified 2d6. The system supposes win, lose, or tie. Double 1s always indicate failure and double 6s always indicate success, regardless of Difficulty Value.

Players control a Ghost as a character. Ghosts begin with a narrative concept. Ghosts have a limited number of Emotions (they have no body and no mind--only memories and emotions). Emotions may be actual emotions (rage), states of mind (agitated), ways of thinking (analytical), philosophies (Stoicism), or worldviews (bigoted). The player and GM must agree on these Emotions. Players distribute 12 Emotion Points among their Emotions to purchase Ranks. Ghosts also have four derived abilities--Intensity, Will, Vitality, and Integrity. Ghost have one or more Drives and one or more Stimuli--these motivate the Ghost. Finally, a Ghost will have an Ego and an Id, both narrative elements.

While the game is mechanically simple it is conceptually quite complex and subtle. Ghosts have memories but no mind, and Emotions but no motivations. They are driven by Stimuli and Drives but these are invariant personality components. Ghosts will interact with the world (or attempt to) in ways that they remember as being familiar, even if these attempts are not particularly successful.

185963.name: Hotwire
185963.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a new collectible RPG in a Golden Age Superheroes vein: to play, you just need any set of the playbooks, with at least one per player. Each playbook gives you a pre-made character and all the rules needed to play them or to run the game for others.

From Introduction:

Exclusive story: the Secret Origin of...Hotwire!
Alien pilot Qel Qes was the best flier amongst her species, but while testing a new stardrive she was thrown across the universe, with no way back! Adopting Earth as her new home, she uses her advanced technological knowledge and strange alien powers to assist the primitive Human Race, whist learning about them and coming to care for them... but will she ever find her way home again?

185964.name: The Witness
185964.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a new collectible RPG in a Golden Age Superheroes vein: to play, you just need any set of the playbooks, with at least one per player. Each playbook gives you a pre-made character and all the rules needed to play them or to run the game for others.

From Introduction:

Exclusive story: the Secret Origin of...The Witness!
