Ace private eye Grant Goode was on the case, but took a bullet to the head in a shoot-out with a murderer. The shooter died, but Grant survived, only the bullet lodged in his brain had greatly enhanced his perception and intelligence! Now by day he works cases for his clients, but by night he dons the mantle of The Witness and engages in his own investigation of the city's worst villains!

185965.name: Letters to the Editor
185965.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome, Faithful Readers! Our mailbag is full of letters from you, eager to know all about the heroes of our stunning comics and how they do what they do! Now, you can't expect us to give away all our secrets right away, as we don't want to spoil any of the terrific surprises we have lined up for you, like the marriage of one of our superheroines to her greatest foe... oops, me and my big mouth! Anyway, there are a lot of questions you're all asking, so here, exclusively to this publication, are the facts you've been clamouring for!

185966.name: Campaign Ideas for Ghostlight
185966.description:
User summary:

This HTML document presents six campaign ideas for the Ghostlight game. They could be used with either version of the game but are specifically written for the Alpha/Smooth version. Each idea presents a title and a single paragraph. The campaign suggestions include:


The Coming of Deluge
The Riverside Bed and Breakfast (requires minor rule variant)
The Knife
The Campus Suicides
The Cult
The Voyage

185967.name: Monster Force Terra
185967.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monster Force Terra is a light storygame using the Apocalypse World Engine to tales of giant monsters who terrorize the Earth but also just happen to save the human race from an even worse threat in the process!

You take on the roles of the kaiju in this game, going about your own business of seeking food, shelter and a mate, when disaster strikes! In getting back to the normal order of your lives, you inadvertently find yourselves becoming the heroes, though you may never be aware of what you've done. Play your monster as a pawn in the story, using them to achieve the goals that you want, by using them to stomp, steal or investigate the story's obstacles.

The download includes twelve different monster playsheets:

The Avian: a giant flying creature.
The Bug: a giant insect.
The Critter: a giant mammal.
The Crustacean: a giant crab or lobster.
The Digger: a giant burrower.
The Glob: a giant mess.
The Lizard: a giant scaly creature.
The Mech: a giant robot.
The Plant: a giant vegetable.
The Simian: a giant ape-like creature.
The Swarm: a giant colony life-form.
The Unspeakable: a giant horror.




There are also two other files:

Monster Force Terra: the core rule booklet, a mere 10 pages long, including tips for the MC on running the game.
Reference Sheet: print this on the back of the playsheets.

185968.name: A Whale of the Problem
185968.description:
From publisher blurb:

It seems that a lot of monsters that get created never make it into the games of our fellow gamemasters. The Tome of Monster Encounters (TOME, for sort) is our attempt to correct that problem.

TOME: A Whale of a Problem is a single encounter designed for use with thirteenth level player characters. It follows the same format as our Encounter Pages series and features:

An encounter for 13th level characters
Updated statistics for the abaia from the Tome of Monsters
Porphyran racial characteristics for fetchlings
Information to set this encounter within the Sea of Ithreia near the Barony of Thuthon

185969.name: As Likely As A Goat Herding Fish
185969.description:
From publisher blurb:

It seems that a lot of monsters that get created never make it into the games of our fellow gamemasters. The Tome of Monster Encounters (TOME, for sort) is our attempt to correct that problem.

TOME: As Likely As A Goat Herding Fish is a single encounter designed for use with first level player characters. It follows the same format as our Encounter Pages series and features:

An encounter for 1st level characters
Updated statistics for Flying Koi and Goatman (Caprian) from the Tome of Monsters
A handful of 3PP spells
Information to set this encounter within the Middle Kingdoms of Porphyra

185970.name: Dark Albion: The Rose War
185970.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dark Albion: The Rose War is a 275 pages long, OSR RPG campaign setting, set in a fantasy medieval England during the War of the Roses (15th century). Think England + sorcery + demons and fairies + some fantasy twists to the world. 80% of the book is system neutral, so can be used with most role-playing games. Nonetheless, this book is designed with OSR games in mind, and will run best with Fantastic Heroes & Witchery (also available on RPGNow/Drivethru), and similar games such as Osric, Swords & Wizardry, etc., as well as the 5th edition of the most popular fantasy RPG! Note lastly that layout and art have been given great care to make the most visually pleasing book as possible: this means 10 maps, and two illustrations per pages on most of the 275 pages!

185971.name: Dark Albion Adventures: The Ghost of Jack Cade on London Bridge
185971.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dark Albion Adventures: The Ghost of Jack Cade on London Bridge, is a 22 pages long fantasy RPG adventure for the Dark Albion: The Rose War campaign setting. It is OSR compatible, meaning you can use it with most OSR role-playing games such as Swords & Wizardry, OSRIC, etc., and of course Fantastic Heroes & Witchery by the same author. It could also be used with 5e rather easily (you just would need to adapt six NPC stat-blocks).

This is a low level (i.e. intended for 1st level, probably newly created, characters) introductory adventure, that occurs on London Bridge. This is mostly an investigation adventure, without dungeon crawls (though several buildings may be explored). It would be typically run in a single 4-5 hours gaming session. This adventure will be perfect to set the mood of a Dark Albion campaign.

185972.name: Extreme Earth (M&M3)
rpgsetting: Extreme Earth: A Dystopian Superhero Setting
185972.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to EXTREME EARTH: A DYSTOPIAN SUPERHERO SETTING inspired by the Iron Age of Comic Books.

Inside you will find:

An introduction to the exciting world of EXTREME EARTH complete with a historical timeline and summary of the current state of affairs
Super Talents: the superpowers of EXTREME EARTH
Rules for creating your own EXTREME EARTH Super Talented characters
A detailed look at the inner workings of FIST: the Department of Federal Investigations into Super Talents
Suggestions for running your own EXTREME EARTH campaign and adventures
Background information on FIST's most dangerous enemies including MANTIS and the Pantheon
An introductory EXTREME EARTH adventure: Merchants of War




Enter a world of corporate greed, government corruption, limited natural resources, and endless warfare where anyone possessing Super Talents becomes a pawn of the Powers That Be. Join the ranks of EXTREME EARTH fans today!

185973.name: Extreme Earth (Savage Worlds)
rpgsetting: Extreme Earth: A Dystopian Superhero Setting
185973.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to EXTREME EARTH: A DYSTOPIAN SUPERHERO SETTING inspired by the Iron Age of Comic Books.

Inside you will find:

rpgsetting: Extreme Earth: A Dystopian Superhero Setting

185977.name: Extreme Earth (Bulletproof Blues)
rpgsetting: Extreme Earth: A Dystopian Superhero Setting
185977.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to EXTREME EARTH: A DYSTOPIAN SUPERHERO SETTING inspired by the Iron Age of Comic Books.

Inside you will find:

185978.name: Extreme Earth (HERO 6E)
rpgsetting: Extreme Earth: A Dystopian Superhero Setting
185978.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to EXTREME EARTH: A DYSTOPIAN SUPERHERO SETTING inspired by the Iron Age of Comic Books.

Inside you will find:

An introduction to the exciting world of EXTREME EARTH complete with a historical timeline and summary of the current state of affairs
Super Talents: the superpowers of EXTREME EARTH
Rules for creating your own EXTREME EARTH Super Talented characters
A detailed look at the inner workings of FIST: the Department of Federal Investigations into Super Talents
Suggestions for running your own EXTREME EARTH campaign and adventures
Background information on FIST's most dangerous enemies including MANTIS and the Pantheon
An introductory EXTREME EARTH adventure: Merchants of War




Enter a world of corporate greed, government corruption, limited natural resources, and endless warfare where anyone possessing Super Talents becomes a pawn of the Powers That Be. Join the ranks of EXTREME EARTH fans today!

185979.name: Extreme Earth (ICONS)
rpgsetting: Extreme Earth: A Dystopian Superhero Setting
185979.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to EXTREME EARTH: A DYSTOPIAN SUPERHERO SETTING inspired by the Iron Age of Comic Books.

Inside you will find:

An introduction to the exciting world of EXTREME EARTH complete with a historical timeline and summary of the current state of affairs
Super Talents: the superpowers of EXTREME EARTH
Rules for creating your own EXTREME EARTH Super Talented characters
A detailed look at the inner workings of FIST: the Department of Federal Investigations into Super Talents
Suggestions for running your own EXTREME EARTH campaign and adventures
Background information on FIST's most dangerous enemies including MANTIS and the Pantheon
An introductory EXTREME EARTH adventure: Merchants of War




Enter a world of corporate greed, government corruption, limited natural resources, and endless warfare where anyone possessing Super Talents becomes a pawn of the Powers That Be. Join the ranks of EXTREME EARTH fans today!

185980.name: Gigantocorp
185980.description:
From the introduction:

In GigantoCorp, you will portray one of countless employees of the megalithic corporate entity referred to as GigantoCorp. GigantoCorp, as its name would suggest, is the largest corporation in the world. It also [is] the only corporation in the world. Every single product, from toothpaste to paperclips to machine gun ammunition, is designed, produced, packaged and sold at GigantoCorp. Similarly, everyone works for GigantoCorp... even the people who are unemployed.

User summary:

Gigantocorp is presented as a series of seven main web pages: Gigantocorp, Furtively Answered Questions, Company History, Employee Handbook, Executive Lounge, Corporate Directory, and Contact Information.

185981.name: Majestic Overwatch
185981.description:
[publisher blurb]

The Moon Dust Men are the tip of the spear. MAJESTIC-12 aims it. Manage the global war against the aliens with this new GUMSHOE subsystem. Do you build retro-engineered Aurora craft, or bioroids to fight on the Moon? Do you launch satellite screens or dig in anti-saucer lasers? You decide where the black budget goes — and who it goes after.

185982.name: Player's Resource
185982.description:
User summary:

Character creation involves Race selection, Specialty selection, and Standard Attack selection. Characters have four Abilities (Strength, Dexterity, Intelligence, and Charisma) and a Stamina score. Attributes have Stats purchased from a point pool; beginning Stats range from 0-4. Characters gain Experience and Levels (1-20).

The Player's Resource is divided into fourteen major HTML sections: Character Sheet, Character Creation, Combat Rules, Reading Abilities, Non-Combat Actions, Character Races, Weapons & Spells, Special Abilities 1-4, Minor Summons, Major Summons, and Status Affects [sic]. The bulk of the game mechanics are found in the Player's Resource (Combat Rules and Non-Combat Actions sections).

185983.name: GM's Resource
185983.description:
User summary:

GM's Resource presents hints and tips for the GM as well as data for various items the players ordinarily should not be aware of. It is presented as eight major HTML sections, namely: Running a Game, Item Values, Enchantments, Items, Swarmers, Bosses, Environments, and Custom Obstacles.

Swarmers generally are weaker monsters found in groups while Bosses generally are tougher monsters that control a bunch of Swarmers or act alone. Environments presents several elements that players likely will encounter, including magical effects and traps. Custom Obstacles discusses methods for making campaign-specific opponents (monsters).

185985.description: Set of two bonus cards for Tesla vs. Edison, Ada Lovelace and Michael Faraday. These cards are used in Phase 1. Ada Lovelace has 2 Inventions, 1 Manufacturing, and 1 Propaganda. Michael Faraday has 3 Inventions and 1 Propaganda.
185985.name: Tesla vs. Edison: War of Currents – Bonus Luminaries
boardgameexpansion: Tesla vs. Edison: War of Currents
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 016 – BGG Con 2015 Recap Extravaganza!!

185986.description:
Type: Weapon
Traits:
Dinosaur
Bludgeoning
2-Handed
Mythic

Check to Acquire:
Strength / Survival 18

Powers:
For your combat check, bury this card to use your Strength skill + 1d20. You may additionally expend any number of mythic charges; for each charge expended, add 1d20. Discard your hand and end your turn.

After playing this card, you may succeed at a Strength or Survival 20 check to recharge this card instead of burying it.

"Throwing a dinosaur is one way to stop a fight-or to start one!"
185986.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – "Improvised Dinosaur" Promo Card
boardgameexpansion: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – Base Set

185987.description:
A card game about player become the chef of food stall (waroong) that cooking traditional food in Indonesia and competing to become the best waroong in Indonesia.

The game consist of a total 80 cards. 40 cards are ingredient card, 20 card are menu card which has different VP each card, and 20 card are customer card which act like action and effect cards. The game played within 2 phase each round, Shopping and Cooking. In the preparation of the game, all card will be shuffled into their respective deck. Open 3 menu card face up in the table and put the rest beside. Each player then will receive a total of 6 ingredient cards for them to play.

In shopping phase, each player will take an ingredient card in their hand and put it face down in front of them. The ingredient taken will be use to "cook" the opened menu card in the table. Then the remaining card will be draft clockwise until the card in front of them has 6 cards total. This card will become a new hand for cooking the menu. The fun coming when drafting, all player must not see the card they already put in front of them face down. They must memorize the card until shopping is completed.

In cooking phase, start from player who have priority cooking, the player will choose witch menu they will cook using ingredient in their hand. Discard the ingredient that use to cook, and take that menu card and 1 customer cards. When taken, fill the the gap in menu card with new menu open from menu deck. The player will cook until they can't cook any menu. When this happen, discard the remaining ingredient to discard pile and the turn cooking will be pass to left player. After all player has their turn to cook over, the next round will be start, open new menu card so the size of menu queue will be up each round up to 6 cards open, pass priority cooking to player clockwise, and then give each player 6 new ingredient cards. Then the phase will be start over from shopping.

The game end when all menu card is already cooked or discarded. The winner will be decide from totaling the score in menu card, and customer card(if any). The player who has the biggest score will win the game.
185987.name: Waroong Wars

185988.name: Cyber:Run
185988.description:
Cyber:Run is a fully cooperative cyber punk tactical-action game for 1-4 players, in which a team of cyber runners must fight their way through a corporate tower completing objectives while difficulty scales. The game makes use of optional video content that can enhance the experience by tying in elements from The Gamers Natural 20.

Players must solve time based puzzles, and collect enough resources to complete 6 objectives to win the game. If enough turns pass without the players completing their objectives, the game is lost.

185989.name: Ortus Regni
185989.description:
The digital version of the tabletop card game Ortus Regni. The app replicates the tabletop experience of Ortus Regni; while also providing tutorial help, and opponents to struggle with for control of a Kingdom that will become England!

Source: The Publisher Website.

185990.name: GLARPS: Generic Live-Action Role-Playing System
185990.description:
User summary:

GLARPS attempts to be a generic, universal system that can handle Live-Action Role-Playing in any genre. The game is run by a Director with one or more Assistants and, depending upon size, a Crew. GLARPS is run in one or more Sessions (3-8 hours is suggested), with connected Sessions making up a Campaign. Resolution of opposed actions is done by observed "Rock-Paper-Scissors", as the game is strictly "no contact" in nature. Uncontested actions use a check against a Difficulty Level. Combat uses a fairly complex method which allows for gradual accumulation of wounds.

Characters have up to 21 Stats (depending on genre) with Points in each Stat ranging from 1 to 4. The Stats are: Art, Athletics, Combat, Computing, Connections, Crafts, Driving, Enigmas, Linguistics, Magic, Medicine, Perception, Physique, Security, Science, Stealth, Subterfuge, Survival, Technology, Wealth, and Willpower. A Point of 1 indicates no training while 4 indicates exceptional ability. Within a Stat, Specialization may be allowed. Characters also may have Advantages (Common Sense, Fast Learner, etc.) and Disadvantages (Arrogance, Migraines, etc.). Characters may gain Experience which can be used to improve Points in Stats.

185991.name: GLARPS Vampire: The Masquerade
185991.description:
From the introduction:

GLARPS Vampire: The Masquerade is the first of a number of world settings designed for the GLARPS system. This add-on was designed for use in the World of Darkness chronicle Northampton by Night, taking place in Northampton, Massachusetts. GLARPS Vampire: The Masquerade does not cover the World of Darkness, although such information can be found at the White Wolf home page.

User summary:

Specific campaign rules govern character creation for Vampires in a Camarilla Clan and notes about Stats used and Advantages/Disadvantages allowed. Variant rules for Humanity for vampires are presented. And the major setting of Northampton is detailed.

185992.name: Arumo, the Kingdom of Wilted Flowers
185992.description:
From the introduction:

Hello, and welcome to the home page of Arumo, the Kingdom of Wilted Flowers. Arumo is a role-playing game set in an exotic world of organic technology and decadent empires, designed to recreate the feel of epic fantasy, complete with heroic quests, evil lords, and terrible monsters, without the typical genre trappings of elves, dungeons, and orc armies.

User summary:

Arumo originally was intended as a full role-playing game with setting but eventually completed development as a setting for a d20 mechanic. In addition to the setting proper, the rules include variants for setting-specific Character Classes, Equipment, Miscellaneous Rules, and spells.

185993.name: The Charcoal Lotus
185993.description:
From the introduction:

In Europe, the bubonic plague never ended.
Arabia was swept and blasted by drought.
The industrial revolution came instead to Asia.
China holds together its empire with railroads, land fortresses, and cannons.
Korea’s navy has established colonies in a mysterious continent to the east.
The cities of Japan are ringed with flying machines and patrolled by steam-driven automata.
The last sorcerers, demons, and wizards struggle to survive, their power crushed by the new machines.
In a world of tradition, ritual, and honor, a new age has come

User summary:

The Charcoal Lotus is a system-neutral setting that could be adapted to a wide variety of core systems. The setting consists on relatively high-level descriptions of large areas and would require substantive detailing for use during play. The setting is described as Japanese Steampunk--"musketeer samurai and bamboo mecha".

185994.name: Godshome: The Divine RPG
185994.description:
User summary:

Godshome provides a very simple mechanic for action resolution featuring d100 rolls against target numbers. The mechanic is so simple that considerable GM adjudication is needed to provide modifiers and targets.

The rules as published as free HTML pages divided into an introduction and three main sections (using an unfortunate black-on-blue color scheme). A fourth section presents a very high-level map of the world of Godshome (three normal continents, one special continent, about fifteen cities).

The three HTML sections include:

Character Sheet (simple, one page)
The History of Godshome (primarily, campaign setting)
Character Generation for Godshome (rules, etc.)

185995.description:
Human being is at the edge - but does not know about!
Mother nature strikes back and reduces the mankind to save the planet from being destroyed by what calls themselves homo sapiens.

Players cooperate in taking the role of a Virus and try to infect people all over the world. They use events like the Olympic Games to spread their deathly effects. To be a step ahead of the human scientists the players develop special features like infection by blood, via animals or resistance against medicals, heat or coldness.

The game is played in clockwise order. In your turn you draw an event card which forces you to take back one or more of your tokens from the board (healing a city). If it is the last one in this city, the "healing token" on the specific track moves forward and you loose, if it meets your marker on that track. The event card gives you some additional "DNS points" (some kind of money) too. In the second step of your turn you spread your virus depending via the infection ways you have developed already. You gain additional DNS-points for each infection (=placing new tokens onto the board in the cities). Third, you develop (buy for DNS) more features for your virus like infection via animal, resistance against coldness or medicine - or your ability to kill people. Finally you throw dice according to your skill for kill and depending on the result you replace your tokens on the board with dead tokens.

The players win, if they have placed all dead tokens in the cities. They loose, if the draw pile is runs out or the human beeings have made enough healing steps on the specific track.

Will you be able to save the planet and reduce the population of the greatest danger for the world: The Human Being?
185995.name: Viroid

185996.name: Pot 'O' Gold
185996.description:
Pot 'O' Gold is themed after playing a slot machine, but is a dexterity game where players take turns spinning gold coloured plastic chips onto the game board. On the game board, there are cherries, oranges, plums, bells, and 7's, separated by pots of gold. If the chip lands on a pot, then the chip is added to the "jackpot". If the chip lands on one of the other symbols, players mark off that symbol on their score pad. After marking off any of the symbols for the fifth time, a player wins the current jackpot, and then that symbol will no longer win a jackpot for any player. The game ends when a jackpot is won for each of the five symbols, with the player with the most chips being the winner.

There is a unique game board design in Pot'O'Gold, where the board is actually 5 giant jigsaw pieces. This does not effect game play, is simply an alternative to having a game board that folds for storage.

In the 1990's, Video Lottery Terminals, or VLTs, became legal in the Canadian province of Alberta, and most bars and lounges had them installed. Different games could be played on the VLTs, including a five wheeled slot machine where you won by matching up cherries, oranges, plums, bells and 7s on a line. Pot'O'Gold is themed after the slot machines on those VLTs.

185998.name: Sonic RPG: Episode 1
185998.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of N/A.




Its a simple rpg turn based game of sonic the hedgehog!

Source: The Game Website.

185999.name: John's Jackpot
185999.description:
The definitive classic jackpot game!
A Flash remake of my first game ever – complete with endings, aggressive commands, and hidden options! First made on a Mac in 1994, and still good!

Source: The Game Website.

186000.name: Jellyfish
186000.description:
Control a complex physics based jellyfish using your mouse. Collect the fish with your tenticles and try and avoid the bad items. .

Source: The Game Website.
